Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!”
Reviews.Author: darora123
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place overall, despite the fact that Internet is not free in the rooms. Amazing options of eating around and all in avwalkable distance. Check out the bar on the rooftop, which gives you a superb view of the Petco Stadium

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Robin_C116
Reviews.Content: Perfect setting for a great night. Roof top bar is great & if you want to get out, there are tons of places to head to in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: Noah M
Reviews.Content: Honestly I had a great stay at this hotel. Like many other reviewers here, I stayed at this property while attending a convention. I found the staff to be friendly, courteous, and helpful. The property itself seems to be well kept, modern, and clean. Our room was spacious, the beds were comfortable, and we had a nice view of the cityscape on the 12th floor. I also enjoyed spending some time on the rooftop socializing with other conference goers. The room rate seemed very reasonable relative to the hotel location and overall amenities offered. My only "gripe" really would be the $10/night fee for in room wifi. Of course something like this is only a minor inconvenience for me and would most likely never be a deal breaker. Based on the price I simply opted to go without given the amount of time I would actually be able to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel but some small issues”
Reviews.Author: Simon K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights while attending a conference at the convention centre. The are quite a few good points to this hotel. Location is excellent, right at the end of the gaslamp area and opposite the ballpark and the convention centre, the hotel bar on the top floor is amazing, a view of the ball park included. The downstairs bar has great staff and a good selection of food. The rooms are nice, big, clean, TV is updated, although at far too low an angle. Unfortunately a few issues drove me crazy while staying here. First off, 9.30am room cleaning? Really? I was woken up on my first morning (after my 14 hour tip) by housekeeping coming in to clean the room. I learned to keep my do not disturb tag outside my room at night. Unfortunately, their seemed to be a window of opportunity, as one morning where I left at 10.30am and returned at 2pm, I found the room wasn't made up at all. Oh well. The proximity of my room to the elevators was also an issue, I can deal with the odd loud guest coming in and out, but I could hear the beeping of the elevator every time it stopped, and in the mornings, this happened a lot. To compound this, there seemed to be some plumbing issue in the rooms too and the drains would start making a loud gurgling noise randomly, when not in use. I didn't really get a good nights sleep there and I probably should have asked to be moved, but busy at a conference and constantly tired, I didn't have the energy, frankly, the staff should identify and block these rooms. I liked the hotel for so many reasons, but I would probably pick another nearby hotel were I to return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for conference center, baseball park”
Reviews.Author: Martin P
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and the location and quality/ value of the hotel is perfect. The staff are pleasant and attentive too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhafez01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night because we were in San Diego for a concert. Check-in went smoothly, we were upgraded to a suite which was nice. The room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was a good size and had standard amenities. The only thing that annoyed me a little is how thin the walls are. There was a group of kids staying on our floor and they were running around and being very loud in the morning. Other than that, no complaints. The location of the hotel is great, right in the middle of downtown, by Petco park. I would stay here again if I visited downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great staff!”
Reviews.Author: loveme32
Reviews.Content: from the valet to the wait staff, everyone went above and beyond! had a great trip which also included marriott in san fran and ventura beach. all were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for a Padres experience”
Reviews.Author: warhorse82
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the convenience to MLB Ballpark (Petco Park) is unmatched in any hotel in the US. Only two issues during the stay. 1. Called ahead (1 week) to request a partial stadium view room. The "we should be able to accomadate that no problem" turned into we don't have one. I guess they shouldn't have housekeeping cleaning one out across the hall as they are telling me tough luck. 2. The internet at this hotel is a nightmare. If you have free internet in your room package then just make the damn stuff wireless with a password or add $10 on the top of the room cost and make it available that way. The Very Good rating is for the cleanliness, location, airline computer terminal in the lobby to print your boarding passes, the "Thanks for Staying" on the way out, and the outstanding valet staff. Those guys were fantastic day and night. All the one way streets in downtown SD were a pain in the rear.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing everything”
Reviews.Author: Scalarnet
Reviews.Content: The Gaslamp is well situated for see many of the sites in San Diego. It is within walking distance of the convention center if that is what brings you to San Diego, but best of all there are many excellent restaurants right outside your doors. Also, this location couldn't be any better if you were wanting to watch the Padres while you are in town. Check ahead for home dates. The hotel is what one would expect from the Marriott brand. Downsides were no free wireless in the rooms and getting a taxi to return to the airport at 5:15 am was problematic. I had been assured that there was a taxi line outside the hotel beginning at 3:30 am, but there were two of us watching the doorman tryinig to hail taxis for us, with very little success. He eventually got one and we shared a ride to the airport. If you have an early morning flight give yourself extra time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kraftar
Reviews.Content: Family and I really enjoyed the hotel. The staff was friendly, rooms were clean and spacious, and the location was very convenient (right next to PETCO park and near plenty of restaurants, etc. in the Gaslamp disctict). Only minor complaint was that the only available parking was with the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Travels129
Reviews.Content: I stay at many marriotts for business travel and this marriott was one of the best I've stayed at. It was in a great location, it was clean, the service was excellent and for the price, it was a no brainer to stay there. I will gladly stay at this hotel again in the future and I recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in gaslamp district with cool outdoor rooftop lounge overlooking Petco field and steps to hrh, cc, restaurants and H”
Reviews.Author: AdvTechVP
Reviews.Content: This is my go to hotel in San Diego and it is as close to the convention center as either the bayfront or the marquis. Rooms are updated since 2011 stay and the rooftop workout center has a great city view of the gaslamp. Everything you could possibly want to do is within 4 blocks of this place, including Hard Rock Hotel, Donovans steakhouse, Searsucker restaurant, great sushi (Nobu and Taka), Savilla and too many bars to list.

Reviews.Title: “Best Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: The hotel accomodations were better than excellent. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous. The location of the hotel is also excellent. It is close to everything, especially PETCO Stadium. I travel to San Diego on business a lot and I usually stay at the other Marriott Hotels. I wanted to try the Gaslamp Quarter and I will definitely be staying here in the future.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: City of Big Bear Lake, California
Reviews.Title: “Best Rooftop View In Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: Desiree P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a prime location near the convention center and Petco park. If you're there on a day the Padres are playing, be sure to go to the roof and see the game. The rooftop turns into a hopping club at night (stayed on the 17th floor and did not hear any noise from club) which after 10 has a line to get in -- but with your room key you'll get priority access with no lines. The rooms are decorated nicely with custom tiling in the bathroom, comfortable beds, and depending on location view of bay, ballpark, or city. Parking standard city around $35 (self parking Ace lot just across street on K about $23). The concierge in the lobby is moderately helpful. There are many, many, many places to eat within walking distance. Bummer though, no pool at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chad M
Reviews.Content: The location was great being right where the action is in the Gaslamp district of San Diego. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was on 12th floor looking into the Padres ballpark which was cool. By using Priceline, it was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: All4vacations
Reviews.Content: Room-large, clean and ready on time...great view into Petco to watch Padres lose again! Area awesome to walk around-staff from the front desk, valets, wait staff all great-all but the "angry" attendant on the conceirge floor. Tried to warm him up twice-forget it-just bitter? He could not ruin an awesome time at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: KTnDC
Reviews.Content: Everything was great - location, staff, room, and value all were all above expectations, especially the staff...it's like they drink some sort of happy@ss tonic before they start work and somehow pull it off as being genuine and sincere. I joke, but it's true. Two observations - 1) for a "fully reinvented" (renovated?) property, the carpets in the hallways (11th floor, at least) are looking a little tired, and 2) A commuter train runs through the entire neighborhood and comes with the requisite horn blast. There are about 12 nice hotels within a few blocks and they're all equally exposed to it...I was glad that I had earplugs. It made the whole thing a non-event, so in combination with the quietness of the hotel inside, and the very comfortable bed, I say sleep quality is excellent with the earplug caveat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: paddyboyfoley
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff making for a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience at Gaslamp Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Boxer550
Reviews.Content: Not bragging here, but I've been to Marriotts in at least 25 countries around the world. San Diego Gaslamp Marriot rates at the top of my favorite hotels. Reason No. 1 it's people. EVERYBODY, from valet parking, concierge, front desk, concierge lounge, every single person in this hotel was great! My room was spectacular, I was upgraded to a fantastic suite that was just right, not tacky not extra-luxurious, just comfortable and classy. Location, well, how about watching a Padres game from the concierge lounge????? Spectacular! and the bar at the 22nd even better. Running, water front running all the way to Lindberg airport 7 miles out and back of beautiful views. Restaurants, best fish tacos ever a block away. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: bob0927
Reviews.Content: the rooms were clean, their staff were helpful,i will stay in this hotel again if i visit san diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: traveling2funxs
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one night stay at the Marriott. Went to Petco Park for Opening Day. The hotel was very busy but the staff did an excellent job. The staff were very friendly, helpful and professional considering everything that was going on. The rooms are very nice, clean and big. And with all the people around, it was very quiet in the room. My only concern with the room is that the sheets were itchy. The sheets seemed worn but the bed was comfortable. Had a great view of Petco Park. Great location from the ballpark, it is just across the street. I would definitely stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Denise E
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. Extremely clean, beds are clean and fluffy pillows. Every employee was excellent! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel in a Perfect San Diego Location”
Reviews.Author: Noseinthewind
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. Location is great - walk to restaurants, the convention center, Seaport Village. Typical high Marriott standards. But I really loved the reception desk - simple minimalistic decore, subdued backlighting and three well placed heaping bowls of candy on the counter. Rooftop lounge overlooks bay & some of Petco Park. Don't pay thru the nose for Marriott's parking though - just park across the steet at 6th & K garage.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Lilymac_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to everything you want, great service, woken up too early by next door guest flushing toilet and showering! Altitude bar is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good +”
Reviews.Author: flipper95
Reviews.Content: Three nights at this hotel in the gas lamp. Felt new, bright and friendly. The room was modern and comfortable. I enjoyed being able to have the windows open and get some of that clean fresh air. I had access the concierge which had real good food, much better than the cheese and nuts you often see or unfrozen spring rolls. My only disappointment on this hotel was the gym. You have to walk through a nightcub on the roof to get to it, and its awkward. the equipment was second tier as well in the fitness center, and it was really warm in the room. I decided to go running instead which is great in that part of town. I recall seeing in a prior rating a complaint about the gym some time ago and the hotel responded saying it was going to be moved elsewhere and updated. That wasnt the case yet when I visited.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego in a great hotel- what more could you ask?”
Reviews.Author: NMackey
Reviews.Content: Great location for convention center. Convenient to huge selection of excellent restaurants. Staff at front desk very helpful- food available to take to your room Great breakfast buffet in comfortable facilities. Good bar and friendly bartender. Big, well appointed room with excellent bed. Well priced. Quick cab ride to airport. Take a water taxi to Coronado to see the historic Hotel del Coronado- fantastic!! Good shopping - and have brunch overlooking the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelwithnancy
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego but decided to spend a night downtown and picked this Marriott because it has our favorite rooftop bar and a fabulous location in Gaslamp area. Everything was first rate -- room, all restaurants, and again, especially the rooftop bar where there is either fun dance music or a DJ later in the evening. It's one of the few places that allows smoking, so the men (or women) can enjoy a cigar.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Stay in Marriott Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pak
Reviews.Content: Pros We stayed in this hotel for 4 days and overall our stay was good. The hotel is located on a very convenient location. 7-10 min walk to the convention center, and 2-5 min walk to some very good restaurants. The restaurants are a bit pricey though. San diego trolley station is just 5 min walk away. The hotel lobby is good and the front desk staff is very polite with big smiles on their faces. We requested a fridge and a microwave and they were provided. The rooms were very clean and modern. The bath room was fully updated with granite counter.They have a roof top patio that provides very good views of down town, marina and petco park. The historical buildings on 5th street are good to see. Cons Check in 15 min late. The room was not ready, Service in the restaurant slow for breakfast. There were only two servers for a lots of people. Continental breakfast buffet in the restaurant was way better then the breakfast in the concierge lounge. I do not know why. Concierge lounge had limited choices and no omellete or pan cake option. For me this was difficult to understand. If you do math, it will cost less to book regular rooms with BF option then to book a room on concierge level. Overall, I recommend this hotel for all it has to offer,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a prime location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravel1055
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp several times for work. It is ideally situated near all the great restaurants on 5th Avenue. The hotel lobby offers free coffee with a selection of creamers to meet anyone's tastes each morning. The concierge lounge serves a decent variety of items for breakfast and evening snacks. The room amenities are very nice and provide a very comfortable stay. Furthermore, some of the rooms have great views of the water. I'd highly recommend this hotel if you are interested in staying in Gaslamp!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and a free ballgame if you're lucky!”
Reviews.Author: TeamBroBra_Intl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and had a room with a view inside the ballpark. Since the weather was amazing, I watched the entire game from the rooftop bar. Very quick walk to all downtown bars/restaurants and the convention center. Staff was extremely helpful. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Carol4travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. Our room was large and had a great view of the city. The hotel is very clean and decorated in a very modern, sleek style. The best part of this hotel is location. You can walk to many attractions. At night make sure you check out the roof top lounge. It has the most beautiful views of city!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasureable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrevlett
Reviews.Content: This property was great. Beds are extremely comfy, felt like home. Size of room and furnishings were more than adequate. Cleaning service was accommodating. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Phil-TargetSolutions
Reviews.Content: we had an event at the Marriott Gaslamp for more than 60 of our clients. From the set up of the meeting space to the guest rooms, everything was top notch! The food was something you would expect to get at a 5 star restaurant, not in a business meeting for a buffet style luncheon. The service was second to none, anything we needed and every question we had was satisfied immediately. Then the topper...was the topper, taking clients to the roof-top bar was an explanation point on the day. Thank you Marriott Gaslamp staff for making this event better than we could have ever hoped!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Room, Very Quiet”
Reviews.Author: tgj777
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for three nights. The room was not huge, but was very clean and quiet. It was located in a great area within easy walking distance to may atractions and great restaurants. the only complaint that I would have is that they way the bathroom doors are (they slide) it does not offer much noise suppression or privacy which is not ideal as a couple. However the staff was great and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Staff, Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kenjini
Reviews.Content: I had a room here and was upgraded to a jr. suite last weekend. Pros: *The staff was extremely accommodating, and I'm hotel snob (stay in way too many), ha, they never became frustrated with me and were very gracious. *The rooms were great, awesome free breakfast for platinum members. *It is in the heart of the Gas Lamp District, so you are walking distance from just about everywhere you want to go. *It is 5 or so minutes walking distance of the convention center. *There's a rooftop bar in the hotel if that is your thing. *Tons of candy in the lobby. Cons: *Marriott Marquis was recently renovated, so the styling is better... and the view there is right on the waterfront, but they don't have a free breakfast there... weigh what you want. Misc. *Goofiest placement of the flat-screens in the rooms, if I had watched TV it probably would've annoyed me. The screens are placed almost below the bed... WHAT THE hey? Front desk said they are going to purchase new armoires for everything. I urge them to hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CRo-315
Reviews.Content: Hotel hospitality was very nice, welcoming staff and I was able to check in an hour early from my told time. The only downside is the parking as there is none. But there are surrounding parking stablishments and parking meters. Weekend is best as you park at a meter you don't have to pay after 6p nor Sundays. Loved my stay, room was super clean and my room view was to ocean. Loved my stay there. CRo.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaM313
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel. The staff is very helpful and friendly - really made my stay. Check-in was speedy, my room was ready early, and the hotel was very clean. Updated, nice bathroom and comfy beds. Would have liked a refrigerator in the room, and I had some difficulty with the internet. Restaurant was good and served generous portions. Location was perfect because I was close to restaurants and shopping, as well as the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, excellent location, super staff and a fantastic overall stay at the Marriot Gaslamp.”
Reviews.Author: Lauraandbobby
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several days/nights and from the time we arrived until we checked out we had a wonderful stay. The staff is super friendly, the room is clean and comfortable, the location was unbeatable. Petco park and the shops of the Gaslamp are right there!! Truly one of the best vacations we have been on. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Location is every thing”
Reviews.Author: Ryan H
Reviews.Content: Great location near everything. Convention Center, ballpark and lots of resteraunts. Roof top bar is an experiance in itself. Want to go back to just relax and watch a game. Short taxi from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “SLAS2012”
Reviews.Author: Scott F
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to restaurants, convention center and water front.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Perks”
Reviews.Author: tomytom
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice hotel with great access to the convention center and the gaslamp district. The roof top bar is a nice touch and if you go there while a baseball game is in progress, you get a free view of the game.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for NYE”
Reviews.Author: EdOverIp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a few days before and after NYE 2012. Absolutely love the location. It's within walking distance to everything Gaslamp has to offer and short taxi or trolley ride to most everything in SD that we cared to visit. The experience was consistent to other Marriott properties we have stayed at over the years. The gave out free internet access to Gold/Platinum elite members, which was nice, but we were disappointed that only Platinum received free breakfast vouchers when the lounge is closed. Only thing we felt was missing was a pool and/or hot tub. We knew they didn't have one but just say. :) Will stay here again the next time we come back to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Fatima G
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the staff is very friendly, mainly the one from the Convention Center. My stay was long - three weeks- but the staff made me feel at home. The only negative point is the non available free access to the wi fi in the rooms (free wi fi only in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Marriot Gaslamp - a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Rostinhos B
Reviews.Content: I stayed i the hotel for 22 days and everything was absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JAHIND
Reviews.Content: Took a winter vacation with my wife and daughters to get away from the Midwest cold. The hotel was recommended to us by a close friend. From the curbside reception, to the front desk, to room staff, everyone was friendly and helpful. The 22nd floor rooftop bar overlooks center field of the Padres Stadium. It is a equally spectacular for the morning sunrise and coffee or Happy Hour and the sunset. We enjoyed both more than once. The hotel is in a great location. It is an inexpensive, 10 minute cab ride from the airport. You do not need a car unless you traveling a long distance. There is a multitude of excellent restaurants and sports bars in walking distance from the hotel. We took the bus to the zoo. It was a simple trip. My wife and daughters pretty much insisted that we return next year. I expect that we will.

Reviews.Title: “My Daughters Wedding December 03, 2011”
Reviews.Author: elsa n
Reviews.Content: Finding a venue for my daughters wedding was stressful UNTIL I called & spoke with the Catering Manager Marle Phonmasy at The Marriott - Gaslamp . I was amazed by her positive energy & honest feed back ! When we met with her I was pleased beyond words ! Her smile, positive energy & "Can Do " atitiude was contagious ! During the next few months Marle presented me to all of the staff involved & everyone made us feel very welcome. Marle gave me invaluable advise & helped me put together an amazing event in under 90 days and I met my budget ! Marle became my right hand & my memory ! No question or last minute change was ever a problem & she was always able to come to my rescue for any last minute " Drama - Trauma" ! My daughters wedding was a huge success & I walked away with a smile !! Heather Campbell the Sales Manager was incredible when it came to helping me place all of my impossible needs for rooms for our guests !! The bottom line - Marle Phonmasy & Heather Campbell along with The Marriott - Gaslamp staff made me look fantastic in front of family & friends ! Our daughter called us early the next morning & was so very grateful for " giving her an amazing wedding " ! I'm still smiling !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Gaucho27511
Reviews.Content: The Marriott has an excellent location within the Gaslamp District of San Diego and the service from staff was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: CharlieKansasCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property the first week of January. The location was very good. It didn't take us very long to get to anywhere we wanted to go in San Diego. The room was very clean and the bed and pillows were the great comfortable ones you get in most Marriotts. The staff were always quick to help, friendly, and helpful. It was a little noisy at night. I heard doors closing and heard during the night the train, sirens, and people yelling outside. If you stayed here during the baseball season, I would definitely not stay in a room facing the ballpark like we had. Staying downtown though, I guess you need to expect noise from outside to bother you if you aren't a sound sleeper. If you want to stay in the Gaslamp Quarter, this would be a good place to stay. I think next time, I will stay north of the city where it is quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gaslamp location”
Reviews.Author: Glasnos
Reviews.Content: We chose the Marriott Gaslamp for its location and was not disappointed. It's location between the ballpark and Gaslamp quarter was great for us. Walking distance to the convention center, Trolley, and quarter. We were there four nights beginning New Year's Eve. The party went from the ground floor to the roof top lounge. New years day came and the hotel had completely been restored to normal use quite a feat given the amount of decorations, food serving areas, and crowd control structure that was in place the night before. Concierge lounge was well appointed. Overall enjoyed my stay and look forward to future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: chairbear46
Reviews.Content: I stayed for NYE and was very disappointed with the service. The front desk manager was curt, rude and unapologetic about a room request made prior to our arrival. I mean why even make the request if it can't be fulfilled? No apology about that either. Oh and they didn't even consider a cot because they allegedly couldn't fit in our room. That's debatable as they fit an armchair, ottoman and floor lamp there. Speaking of furniture the tv in our room had a purple line through it. If you're paying a premium rate you expect a higher level of service. Not tonight apparently. Altitude has great views and the venue was the one highlight of that night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Petco, convention center, or Gaslamp.”
Reviews.Author: Gpgoodnight
Reviews.Content: Just got back and had a great time. The rooms are very nice. Hotel very convenient to the local sites and is a block from the trolley. The staff was fantastic as well. Only downside is the parking. $38 a day is pretty tough. The bar on the roof is a great hangout.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel for location, friendly staff, two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: holidaydreamin
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were very nicely allowed to check in, and automatically upgraded to a room with views of the harbour and petco park as I am a Marriot rewards member. The front desk lady was friendly and made us feel welcomed. Check out was a breeze as well. Location wise, it is 1 block or 5 min walk from the Gaslamp trolley station, where there is a vending machine that one can buy the day pass trolley tickets, and the hotel is also near to the restaurants and shopping area. The room was clean and bed comfortable, and generous toiletries provided. For the price, location and room, its really value for money. It is also away from the Market street area where there are many homeless people, and is safe to walk around at night as well. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who's looking for a hotel at the gaslamp area.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Time”
Reviews.Author: Kristin D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed celebrating our anniversary at The Marriot. It was quiet, the rooms were nice, and the staff was friendly. The location was perfect for us. We were able to either walk or take the trolley anywhere we wanted. The breakfast was wonderful and the ladies were friendly and they kept everything fresh and filled for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and extremely clean”
Reviews.Author: mytwocentsTO
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Diego and thanks to reviews on Trip Advisor we picked a great hotel. Everything was perfect with our stay. The staff were super friendly, from the front desk staff, wait staff to the valet guys. They were all so helpful. Everything is within walking distance, shopping, restuarants and cafes. The rooms were spotless, the baseboards were even shinny. We liked the glass shelves in the bathroom, it came in handy to store our toiletries. We booked directly from the Marriott website and got a great AAA rate with parking and breakfest for two included. The buffett breakfest was one of the best we have ever had. The variety of foods offered were endless. We loved there house made granola. There are even made to order delicious omelette, pancakes and french toast options. There are so many hotels to choose from in the Gaslamp Quarter but we were so pleased we chose the Marriott and we would stay there again and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: travelbug81988
Reviews.Content: when we arrived people were so welcoming. The rooms are VERY clean and everything looked brand new. The beds were comfortable and the shower was perfect. Altitude Lounge is located at the rooftop and it has an awesome view. There was one thing my friends and I did not like and that was that it did not have a swimming pool, other than that it was a very good hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick vacation to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: djt_888
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, very nice staff, EXTREMELY clean. Rooms look like brand new. Very convenient location - one block to the western end of the gaslamp district. Booked a very good AAA rate with breakfast buffet for 2 included. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMarina
Reviews.Content: Great bed, great bedding, peaceful and quiet refuge from the street. Staff was attentive, friendly and helpful. Super location by PETCO park. We parked in a garage around the corner, because we wanted inexpensive access to our car, but we ended up not needing our car at all. Everything was in walking distance, including the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Oztripper_1
Reviews.Content: The Marriott San Diego Gaslamp Quarter is a great base for exploring San Diego. Its located in the vibrant Gaslamp area which has much to offer in terms of restaurants and shopping. Its also close to public transportation (which was both clean and efficient). The hotel was very nice. Rooms were quite spacious and the beds were comfortable. Although close to "the action", the hotel is far enough away not to be bothered by noise (we stayed on the 16th floor). Our room overlooked Petco Park - an interesting outlook - especially when there are events in progress in the Park. We were treated to fireworks during the Veterans's day long weekend. Hotel staff were helpful and accommodating when we had to make a last minute change to our booking. Restaurant food was fine for lunch and dinner - but a little ordinary for breakfast. However, there are plenty of alternative options in nearby hotels and cafes. An overall enjoyable stay in a nice hotel at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tim5055
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Mariott property for two nights in November 2011 for work. When traveling for work I am normally working a midnight shift so certain amenities are helpful to me. First off the hotel staff understanding that I'm sleeping during the day and do not want to be disturbed by housekeeping. I'm sorry to say even with the do not disturb sign out most properties still knock to ask if I want service. I'm happy to say San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter did not. They just left a not on the door to say they stopped by and if I needed anything to call. I appreciated this touch! Again, I have to compare this to other stays - I normally have to set the A/C way down to keep the room cool but this location the A/C worked great!! The curtains would close completely and totally blacked out the room. The room was well appointed with a large comfortable bed, chair & ottoman plus a desk that is actually set up for work. Plenty of desk space and convenient plugs right up front so it is easy to set up your computer. The room was very clean and everything was in order. Within an easy walk to the convention center as well as numerous clubs, restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Hopefully I'll be able to get back for a vacation rather then work so I can enjoy everything this property has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice alterntative to the bigger San Diego Marriott”
Reviews.Author: msandman
Reviews.Content: Not to be confused with the much larger San Diego Marriott, the Marriott Gaslight District hotel is a pleasant, smaller alternative its sister Marriott at the other end of the San Diego Convention Center. . It’s located a short walk away from the strip of restaurants along 5th Ave. , which is the “Main Street” of the Gaslamp District. The hotel is also walking distance from the Convention Center and from Petco Park, the baseball stadium that’s home to the Padres. (it’s a really nice baseball stadium, despite the stupid name.) The rooms and service are standard Marriott, which is to say very good. If there’s any negative, it’s that the breakfast lounge for Marriott “Rewards” guests is a bit small and the choices are a bit more limited than they would be at the big Marriott up the street. It’s a very pleasant place to stay if you like an attractive, well run hotel that’s not supersized.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly Unpretentious - Marriott Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: The_Wine_Snob_NJ
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Gaslamp sits just a block from 5th avenue, just far enough to be quiet but conveniently close to shops, bars and restaurants. The hotel also has a decent restaurant on the ground floor and a nightclub bar on the roof that overlooks Petco Park, home of the Padres. The hotel sports a decent gym, but nothing to get excited about, and it is very close to the water where the is a great sidewalk trail for running with plenty of runners and numerous attractions to make it interesting. The hotel is well maintained, the rooms are very clean and decent size. The front desk staff is exceptionally efficient and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carrie K
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was in a great location within walking distance to everything - restaurants, convention center, Petco Park, etc. The room was clean and comfortable and the price was very affordable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I will be staying here next year when I come back for my business conferance.

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness - no multiple night minimum stay”
Reviews.Author: KarlPCalgaryAB
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to San Diego, we had to book our last night at a different hotel from the rest of the visit due to a wedding party that had booked our entire hotel. We had a very hard time finding a desirable hotel that would allow us to book only one night (a Saturday). Most other hotels that we tried insisted on a 2 or 3 night minimum (on a weekend). So we ended up at the Marriott Gaslamp Quarter. A nice hotel, right next to Petco Park. We were assigned to a high floor and the view was decent, facing east. The room itself was nothing fantastic, but suitable for our last night in San Diego. The location gave us an opportunity to check out the Gaslamp Quarter and the waterfront between the convention center and the USS Midway museum. So as far as location is concerned, not bad at all. We arranged a breakfast special which included a buffet breakfast as part of the room charge, which was perfect for us. The hotel has a well known roof-top outdoor bar, but we didn't have time to check it out. The business center was available for airline web check-in, so we were able to book our seats and print our boarding passes. Wireless internet was not included in the room price, which for me is a huge disappointment. You'll know from any other of my hotel reviews that as far as I'm concerned, with hotel prices being what they are, I don't see why they can't just include Wi-Fi for free. The beds were comfortable. I noticed that because of the location, it is possible you will hear the sounds of druken revellers in the streets below in the wee hours of the morning. But although I did hear some commotion (we opened our window), it wasn't so bad that we were unable to sleep. Your mileage may vary. Overall, not a bad hotel, in a great location. We still like the Pacific Beach neighbourhood better, but if you have to stay downtown, this isn't a bad place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Sites and sounds”
Reviews.Author: AlumofCU
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is located in the Gas Lamp District of San Diego. It is very convenient to the sites and happenings of downtown San Diego. You don't need a car for venturing out. Everything is within walking distance including a wide variety of restaurants that meet any taste or budget. Don't exclude walking down to the harbor for lunch or dinner as there are places down there right on the harbor. The gym facilities are on the 22 floor and you'll have a great view of Petco Park from up there. The Altitude bar is really fun on weekends but going up in the morning and seeing the views of the surrounding area (Bring a coffee or tea in the morning) in the morning is really spectacular. They do not have an airport shuttle. Cab ride will run you about $12 or so. Parking at the hotel is expensive and they don't offer self park, just valet (available 24 hrs) though there are parking garages around the area. Also, coffee service every morning in the lobby til 8:30 am. Concierge Room is small but adequate. Enjoy a walk along the harbor just minutes away or take in a workout on the stairs of the Convention Center on the weekends. Really fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Amentities”
Reviews.Author: ATLJetSetter
Reviews.Content: This Marriot is very well maintained with a very clean lobby, plenty of elevators and a great rooftop bar and gym. The views from the rooftop are fantastic with a line of sight right in to Petco Park! Everything was very well maintained. The maintenance team had to come in to my room for some kind of air leak in the A/C but he was very quick and polite and even gave me a free breakfast for my troubles. Talk about service! While the hotel is a great price, the taxes, parking etc... can add up fast. Be prepared when booking!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: jdjn9
Reviews.Content: After reading all these glowing reviews I guess I was somewhat let down. It felt like a typical hotel, room size a little on the smaller side even after I had upgraded. The Gaslamp area was somewhat of a let down but that's not the hotel's fault. Room service was average, hotel front desk staff helpful. The one thing that surprised me was no concierge services after 12 on Fri and all weekend? Are you kidding me? Actually, I don't know when the concierge left because we did go down to speak to someone at 11:45A and they were already gone so maybe no services on Fridays at all. I really do enjoy and utilize concierge services in hotels so this was a big minus for me, maybe not so much for others. Probably wouldn't stay here again as I think I would have gotten more value for my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent example of Marriott at its best”
Reviews.Author: scotsroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location with excellent quality rooms and pleasant enough staff, very good concerige lounge here and hs to be one the best Marriotts in the country. Only real downsides to here are the steep ($34) valet parking and the lack of a pool but it does have a great workout area on the roof with views of landing jets and a roof top bar with great views of the water and Petco park

Reviews.Title: “Good times in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mckmetal8
Reviews.Content: if you need to get away.. just cruise on down to this spot!! Great location. Great concierge!!! love the fun candy at the front desk and you can't forget the roof top bar for sunset then late night..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: neerajmodi
Reviews.Content: Nice for the money. Negative points for no pool. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ZahraJ
Reviews.Content: Excellent Value. Beautiful Location. Lovely Hotel. The only item I want to mention is to not leave you wallet or phone anywhere in the lobby. I lost my PDA as I was checking out. Thank God it was insured.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms with lot's of dark wood”
Reviews.Author: DaSpazz
Reviews.Content: The rooms and hotel are very attractive with alot of wood accents. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is small but relly nice. The counters are granite and top of the line ammenities. This is your classic adult hotel not for families. There is not a pool or really anything for the kids but a great choice for business or couples. I have stayed at 15 to 20 hotels downtown and the Marriot would be my second favorite. I will stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to stay for a first visit to San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: rossbet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1906 over the Labour day weekend for 3 nights. The high room had a great view over the water as well as looking into "Petco" park, where the Padre's were playing every day. The room is typical Marriott quality, well designed and well finished, the lobby is very open and attractive and has free wifi. The Soleil restaurant is at one end and the reception is at the other. It is well worth a visit to the Altitude bar on the 22nd floor open rooftop with fantastic views over the city. We were able to get a room package (AAA/CAA) which included buffet breakfast and valet parking which made the actual room costs very reasonable for a downtown, quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service and location.”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl102393
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, the service and the close proximity to everything. the rooms were very nice and they had a great concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: AlfredoL1
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel especially the bar on the 21st floor, it is outside and the view is incredible, you can watch a Padre's game from it.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: IITrips
Reviews.Content: location is excellent. rooms were nice and clean. staff was helpful. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest staff in the industry”
Reviews.Author: Edward M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in and the young lady asked the purpose of our visit. I told her it was our 55th wedding anniversary and she and her fellow front desk personnel congratulated us with much enthusiasm and in a truly heartfely manner. It was indeed touching. Later that day there was a knock on our door and a young man came in carrying a bottle of champagne and a large plate of chocolate covered strawberries. What was most coveted though was a card signed by the staff containing a hand drawn heart with an arrow through it. Whenever we walked through the lobby the staff waved or said hi to us. I have always valued the quality of service at Marriott but have never experienced such a genuine outpouring of well wishes from a staff anywhere at anytime. Our thanks to all at Mariott Gaslamp for helping us make our 55th something very special indeed. Ed & Elizabeth Murray

Reviews.Title: “Great location for singles, not for family”
Reviews.Author: Mendelssohnian
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute trip to San Diego and saw a great deal for San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter ($99.00). However, we didn't read through the details so when we arrived at the hotel we were surprised by the $30.00 a day parking. There are many nearby restaurants and shops. The room is clean but a bit of old looking. They tried to upgrade their image by having Starbuck coffee (to get more you need to paid!) and Tazo tea in the room, and better bath toiletries; however, the room still look a bit outdated. The beds are comfortable and the room is clean, and if you are a baseball fan, the rooftop lounge (18 and older) has a great view of the PETCO ballpark. Definitely a hotel for singles. They don't even have a pool. I wouldn't go back to this hotel as I know there are many other better ones with similar prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: noelle_Ians_mom
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to San Diego yesterday. We stayed at the Marriott in the Gaslamp and have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. You really can't beat the location. It is 2 miles to the San Diego Zoo, 5 miles to Sea World, and Petco park is adjacent to the hotel. There are tons of restaurants and bars within walking distance. The Altitude bar on the top of the hotel is great! We could only go up during the day because we had the kids with us, but it overlooks Petco Park so you can watch the game from there. You can also look into the park from the concierge lounge. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to the concierge floor. I am not sure why we were upgraded other than that my husband is a silver (or maybe gold, not sure) Marriott rewards member, but it was a very nice perk. We got free continental breakfasts and h'ordeuvres, free Wifi, and there was a computer and printer in the lounge that came in handy for printing our tickets for our activities. If you are lucky enough to be upgraded, be sure to get a to go container for your breakfast and you can take it up to the Altitude Sky Lounge and eat your breakfast outside. The room was very nice and clean. The kids loved that the turn down service included rock candy and Oreo cookies each day. I am not sure if this is a perk of being upgraded or if they do this for everyone, but the kids loved it! They also had bowls of candy in the lobby. The only drawback to the room was that there was no refrigerator. The hallway carpets were a little on the dingy side, but other than that I was completely happy with the hotel (and I am a high maintenance kind of girl). The staff was super friendly! Everyone we met from the maid to the valet guys were super friendly and helpful. Outstanding service. If you get a chance to go to a Padres game, I highly recommend it. We're not Padre fans, but it was still fun and the tickets are so cheap that we were able to sit in the 8th row. The kids got to meet some of the players and they will sign autographs. The best part was that it's right next to the hotel so there was not fighting traffic. We also went to Heavenly Cupcake for my son's birthday which is just a few blocks from the hotel. They were really good, but a bit pricey. We ate a Bud's one evening and recommend it. If you are on Foursquare you can check in and get free tater tots. There isn't a kids menu, but they did have chicken tenders and sliders and what kid doesn't love tater tots? My husband also recommends the Strip Club which which is a restaurant where you pick out your own steaks and cook the steaks on a grill. We did not do this on this trip, but he was there a few months ago and said it was neat experience and the food was good. We also found a great breakfast/brunch place called Mary Janes. We loved it. I had a great breakfast burrito and the kids enjoyed the bottomless bowl of cereal and Mickey Mouse shaped pancakes. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SyntheticMilk
Reviews.Content: A very up-to-date, fresh and beautiful hotel. The lobby was magnificent and the rooms superb - especially our view of PetCo park, a special treat to see so close from that angle, day and night. If you love atmosphere, you'll love hearing the crowds on game nights. Room service appears to be a selection from the menu of the restaurant downstairs - Soleil@K (which we had visited on one night of our stay). The chicken we ordered was delicious, absolutely faultless. The one problem we had concerned check in. When we arrived, at approx 3:30pm (30 minutes before regular check in) we were told our room had not been prepared (perfectly acceptable, of course) and they would let us know when it was ready. Unfortunately once 4pm rolled around, we were not contacted by staff (as promised) and waited longer than necessary before returning to the desk ourselves and asking what the status of the room was - the room was ready, of course - it was past 4pm! Something unusual for a chain hotel, the shower head in the bathroom was fantastic, nothing like any of the usual sort you would expect. Check out via the in-room service was quick and easy, though the instructions laid out on the paperwork left at our door was outdated and possibly misleading to those not so technologically literate. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting PetCo park, the Gaslamp Quarter, SDCC, The Broken Yolk Cafe (as seen on Man V Food! This cafe is on the same block, just around the corner) and even for anyone looking to stay close to the Amtrak station, a mere $7 taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Thelma & Louise”
Reviews.Author: Snackcake
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott Gaslamp was wonderful. Close to all the major restraunts and action of the Gaslamp area. Evening walks were great and always full of adventure. The hotel is in a class of it's own. Altitude Sky Lounge on the roof is a great place to meet friends and have a good time. We were there for a Padra's game and you can see the game from the lounge. The service at the Marriott was perfect. High end and fantastic time. Thanks Marriott, for making our girls vacation fun fun fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Emersom
Reviews.Content: Attended a family affair here and couldn't have been more pleased. Every individual enjoyed the rooms, the Altitude Bar and convenient proximity to the transit station and local bars and eating establishments. The staff assisted us with dinner plans (for 18, on a Saturday, with the Padres in town) and shared their local knowledge. I intend to be back, with a much smaller group, soon. 75 degrees in late July?!? Priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Rmil342
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here and we will surely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: je1014
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotwl in San Diego. Righht across the street from PetCo Park. Near lots of great restaurants on 5th St. Cool bar on the top floor. Modern, clean, good service. Can't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “This was a great location!”
Reviews.Author: VermontTeacher44
Reviews.Content: The folks at the front desk were very attentive and helpful. Our double room was very comfortable and tastefully furnished. We would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week at Marriott”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent an amazing week at the San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter. From the time we arrived, we were treated to wonderful service by all of their employees. Every time we encountered an employee from valet, front desk, bell desk, housekeeping, concierge lounge and Altitude, we were greeted and welcomed. Service was some of the best we've ever encountered and we're platinum rewards members so that says alot. We hope to return next year for our annual San Diego vacation and trek to Comic-con. Thank you Marriott for a wonderful week!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Eye004
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed. The rooms were great, the service was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcopelan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding this past weekend. The rooms are very nice and spacious, with all the amenities you expect from a Mariott. By far the best part of this hotel is the Altitude Sky Lounge on top of the 22nd floor! We visited this place twice during the visit and the views are spectacular. All day happy hour on Sundays as well. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hub for a destination wedding”
Reviews.Author: travelfoodie1018
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott during a friends wedding weekend recently. I am so happy they choose this hotel because it offered some great ammenities during our time in San Diego. First of all, the hotel was very nice to my friend, the Bride, and was always asking her if there was anything she needed, etc. They were also nice enough to offer my Husband and I early check -in as I needed to be there early one day for wedding festivities. Our room was very nice and had a great view of the water and petco park. The location of the hotel is nice and within walking distance of lots of places downtown. The only two downsides were that there was no pool or spa, and from our room we could hear the nighclub on the roof. If I was here for a random weekend, that noise would most certainly bother me, so if you don't like pounding music till after 2am, you might want to ask for a room far away from the nightclub. The hotel was the place for the rehearsal dinner, which I thought was good. The appetizers were tasty and the service was great. All in all, I would go back to this hotel for sure. It was a nice place and very acommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to Avoid”
Reviews.Author: kkailas
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel to avoid since there are several choices, including Marriotts nearby. Very poor service. I traveloften and stay mostly at Marriotts and am an Elite member. No recognition of the Elite status at this hotel. Very restrictive policies on changes, including early checkout oenalties, which are not even in the fine print of the reservations. I will be back in San Diego later this month and am not staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Cool gym on top floor with outdoor bar/nightclub.”
Reviews.Author: Happydayy
Reviews.Content: Room fine, hotel lobby very stylish and cool. Lobby restaurant not very bright - so we always go to the Hilton for breakfast. Next to Petco.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but lots of negatives”
Reviews.Author: Talaga_LA
Reviews.Content: My gf and I spent 3 nights here over the long 2011 4th of July weekend. We loved the location, but there are several reasons we'll stay elsewhere next time. First the good: * Location - Only 1 block From the southern end of the 5th street Gaslamp district. Loads of restaurants & bars nearby and within walking distance of Balboa park (a bit of a walk, so likely not good for small children or older folk). * Cleanliness - Very clean & reliable maid svc. * Toffee - Big ol' bowl at reception that my gf couldn't get enough of. * French Toast - Mighty tasty French toast that comes w/ an otherwise average bfast buffet. However, skip the buffet unless it is included w/ your room rate. You can find much better for the $18 they otherwise charge. * View - We had a 17th floor room that had a decent view of the water and the unexpected fireworks on Fri, Sat & Sun nights. However, if on a lower floor, your view is likely to be of the neighboring building's windows (i.e. keep your drapes closed). Now for the bad: * Mattress - It was one of the oldest, most uncomfortable ones I've slept on. The mattress & springs were ancient & they simply tried to improve it w/ a 1" think mattress pad. Needless to say, it didn't work & made the bed not only too soft, but also lumpy. * Toilet - Mot only was the bathroom quite small, but the toilet flush was extrely loud - both from within the room and from neighboring rooms (both on the same floor & above). Both my gf & I were awoken several times by it. There is absolutely no way to sleep through it, especially if your partner needs to use it in the middle of the night. * Age - While marriott does a good job of keeping it updated, it is getting older. From the tiny bathrooms to the thin walls, the infrastructure can't be changed. * Valet - Luckily parking was included, otherwise it would've been something like $34/night. Plus, they left my car door ajar for 2+ nights such that my battery was completely dead, required a jump to leave (which took 45+ minutes), and had to be replaced when I returned to LA. Not reasonable for a battery/car that is less than 2.5 yes old. * Management - My gf and I were a little bored & wanted to leave a day early to spend a night in Temecula. I'm a Mariott Elite who spends 30-40 nights a year in Mariott hotels. When I asked if it would be a problem tocheck out a night early, the day manager went into contract mode and stated the hotel's non-negotiable $150 early departure fee. When I simply asked if there was any way this could be waived for a good customer, she pulled out my signature on the reservation form, pointed to the fine print and said "see you signed in agreement of this fee when you checked in". I was taken aback as I was not being the least bit argumentative and ws simply asking if there was leeway. She couldn't care less and was quite rude. Amyway, the hotel is decent, but there are MANY, MANY, MANY (did I say many?) more options in the area. I'll most definitely try another (non-Mariott property) next time.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Gaslamp...great location, lots of walking!”
Reviews.Author: JForster154932
Reviews.Content: the Marriott is nice and rooms are large, ask for ocean and "Petco" view, on the even side. Front desk good, bellboys great! even give you water when when you go out...concierge is a boy and keeps reffering to you as "his mother", but other than that the staff are very friendly. Bathrooms in the rooms are very spacious, nicely supplied and complimentary loofas..hallway carpets could use replacing. If you want transportation to harbourside, take the orange line by the Convention Centre- Harbourside take the "Hornblower" around the bay tour of catch the Coronado ferry. Conceirege boy will make your res and save you $4.00 pper. Lastly- check out the lounge upstairs rooftop- good views of the bay and Petco and a great outdoor fireplace, Conde Naste says it is one of the "top rooftop bars"...it has a very nice feel about it but ..many single business guys and girls just looking to get lucky but some other casual folks as well just enjoying a nice west coast bar. Overall great location and pretty good, young staff...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: SweetMichael95030
Reviews.Content: You could not find a better spot in The Gas Lamp. We walked to everything. The staff was friendly and eager to please. The roof top bar is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot comes through for 1 year Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: 4chip
Reviews.Content: I cannot express the delight I have towards the Marriot Gaslamp Quarter. This gift for my niece and her husband's 1st year anniversay was meant to allow them some time together as a "newly wed" couple. Marriot did not only get them an awesome room but the hospitality from the staff was most notable. As they stated and I quote, "I now know how it feels to be treated like a valued guest" Thank you Marriot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms. Terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are a step over your standard Marriott room and definitely feel more luxurious. No issues with comfort and cleanliness. Location is great whether you're walking or driving (there is a parking garage right across the hotel so you do not have to pay the hotel's inflated valet prices). I did run into problems with a member of the front desk staff who rudely asked me to produce a paper confirmation of the reservation I made on Marriott.com (I have never been asked for a paper confirmation in over 300 nights with Marriott) and threatened to not honor the stay 2 get the 3 night free package I booked. Luckily Marriott customer service solved the situation. Didn't think service at this hotel was up to the standard you expect from Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mlcw
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and found the rooms and service to be very good. Beds are very comfy and the room is a good size. Housekeeping does a good job keeping the room clean. Parking is a hefty sum, so would recommend parking in the self-park lot across the street if you don't need to move the car very much. Food at the hotel restaurant is average and the wait staff could do with some additional training. If you stay on the concierge floor be aware that the complimentary breakfast is only available until 9:00 a.m. This is the only Marriott we have stayed with that wraps up breakfast at such an early hour. In fact, we were unable to enjoy the concierge breakfast due to this early closing time. I would recommend the hotel extend the hours for this to at least 10:00-10:30 a.m. and charge a reasonable rate for overnight parking. Otherwise, a very nice stay and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott -- Fine Property but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: PinguinVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter hotel over a weekend in June 2011. It's a fine hotel but nothing out of the ordinary for a Marriott. The location is good -- especially if you are baseball fan since Petco Park is literally steps away from the front door and we had a view of the field from our room. Unfortunately, the Padres were away for the weekend. The room was comfortable but nothing to brag about (the bathroom in particular was pretty small). The bed was too soft for my taste. Our reservation included the breakfast buffet, which was excellent, as was the service. We also ate dinner there on our last evening (a Sunday) when the restaurant was dead. There was only one other party seated at the same time. The Gaslamp is one of San Diego's hip areas but it is not for everyone. Plenty of restaurants and bars, which is both a plus and a minus. There are tons of options but there were a lot of drunk people as well as pretty aggressive homeless people around. I never felt unsafe but some people may be very uncomfortable staying in this part of town. I had combined a stay at the Marriott with one at the Del Coronado across the Coronado bridge. Nothing against Marriott, but for the extra $80 a night I wished I had just stayed at the Del.

Reviews.Title: “Great service recovery”
Reviews.Author: Sooner100
Reviews.Content: As a lifetime Platinum member at Marriott (over 2,000 nights in my travel career) I have seen the good and the mediocre (never bad at a Marriott property). My wife and I spent five nights at the Marriott Gaslamp Quarter during the summer travel season. The hotel was very busy on both Friday and Saturday nights (our first two nights). On our floor, there was some sort of a party group that screamed and cursed in the hallway on both nights well after midnight. When I called to the front desk, they sent security up but were unable to keep the group quiet. On Sunday morning, June 19, we went to the front desk to express our concern and asked to be moved to a different floor. Not only did they move us, but they gave us a better room at no additional charge. While I don't blame the hotel for the rowdy guests (not much they could do in advance), I do appreciate that they went the extra mile to satisfy a frequent quest. By the way, great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Some good some bad”
Reviews.Author: TravelPro1977
Reviews.Content: Great location for SD game or partying on 5th ave (if you are into that) Parking was absurd at $34 a night. Concierge lead us to poor restaurant, seemed like she was not well informed on all the restaurants or the difference btw good food and expensive food. Bar on top of hotel was cool with great view. Staff was overall good. If you get a room with 2 beds that are very small, and the rooms are older.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: EricSchuur
Reviews.Content: We were in SD for a short family visit. The Gaslamp Marriott is a nice hotel in a good location. Friendly staff and nicely appointed, standard size room. The location is quite convenient to the airport, freeways and other travel routes which makes it simple, even on weekdays, to reach various destinations around San Diego. My one wish is that the Marriott would maintain a larger gift shop/convenience store, as there is not really one nearby. We enjoyed our stay and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great experience and plan to return”
Reviews.Author: WWACPATUBA
Reviews.Content: This was the firs time I stayed at this Marriott and I was very pleased with the attention to detail the hotel staff provided; especially the assistant manager...I believe her name was Kate(?)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location - Lovin' It”
Reviews.Author: luvmms
Reviews.Content: We went during Easter weekend and you would think that it was going to be crowded and service would suffer, but everything went smoothly! This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this hotel and it was great each time! Perfect location to catch a game at Petco Park and great restaurants all around! We did catch a game and had a fabulous birthday dinner with my husband and kids! Both were literally across the street! I called ahead to see if we can get some view of Petco Park since it was my husband's birthday and the room we stayed in did not disappoint! The room was spacious and had an amazing view of Petco Park. The kids really liked and they hung out by the window to just watch as the park filled up. ***One important tip, if you are checking in on a game day, it's best to get there at least a couple of hours ahead to beat the traffic, in and around the park. As they may close off some of the street close to the hotel*** I don't think I can stay anywhere else when we come to San Diego! We just love the San Diego Gaslamp Marriott! (We love the Marriott chain of hotels, so we are a little partial)

Reviews.Title: “Great service, awesome staff, I will stay here on my next San Diego trip!”
Reviews.Author: AliciaD1209
Reviews.Content: Great staff!! Concierge (Catherine) was phenomenal!! I will most definitely stay there again. Check it out!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic hotel, will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: IchibanAkita
Reviews.Content: We love the Marriott chain. My husband and I go to conferences a lot and typically stay in the nearest Marriott (more often than not it's also the conference hotel) so we decided to stay with them again for our mini-vacation to San Diego. They work very well as conference hotels but we were surprised by how pleasant our leisure stay was. This hotel is perfectly situated - a 15 second walk to the gates of Petco Park, a minute walk from the San Diego Convention Center, and close to more restaurants and bars than we could visit. We were also able to comfortably walk to many other interesting areas (such as the Marina - we walked down to the Star of India with no problems) and were in easy driving distance of other fun places (such as the Loma lighthouse). My only gripe was that the hotel only has valet parking. But this is a common problem in most San Diego hotels. My husband was extremely pleased by the giant bowl of saltwater taffy that lives in the foyer and the Starbucks coffee provided in our room. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ror87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter on our way back from Hawaii. The hotel is very clean and the staff friendly. It's also in a great location. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room & Service”
Reviews.Author: taxman8000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel and it was an excellent hotel with an outstanding view of the surrounding area. The service was very good and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location and GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfer047
Reviews.Content: Get a day pass for the train and buses--you can go far and see much! Don't miss a meal at the Fish Market!

Reviews.Title: “Geat hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: blue-green160
Reviews.Content: Real nice hotel in excelent location. Friendly, smart staff. A hundred restaurants and the harbor with-in a few blocks. Convention center 2 blocks. Clean and nice lookiing place. I would get room facing the city - probably even numbered rooms. I'm in #911 and the window looks out on an ugly roof. Wi-Fi 9.95/day. I paid $161 ++

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Cool Location”
Reviews.Author: irishfaith
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days and I loved the location. So many restaurants and bars within walking distance. The baseball stadium was across the street. I loved that they had a roof top bar! Very nice atmosphere! The staff was really fantastic! Very helpful and courteous! Just what I've come to expect from Marriott. I was attending a conference in the hotel and the room was set up perfectly - the temperature was good and the food served was really good for a hotel conference! I was very impressed overall. I would love to stay there again. The only downside was you had to valet your car and that was $34/day.

Reviews.Title: “Always Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: tw107
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, efficient and modern facility. Would not consider staying elsewhere. You can watch a ballgame from the rooftop bar!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: geopalmer
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is located just outside the main entrance to Petco Stadium (San Diego Padres). It is in the "Gaslamp" section, which is an area filled with bars and restaurants. A mall is about a 6-8 block walk from the hotel. Very near the SanDiego Convention Center. Rooms were clean and quiet. Good, quiet air conditioning/heating system. Car necessary for travel to beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable beds and great staff”
Reviews.Author: jschm50755
Reviews.Content: You won't want to get out of these beds. I had a room on the 20th floor looking down on the ballpark and across the water at Coronado. Great roof top bar looking out over the city. The only negative is parking at $34 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Flexible and Friendly Staff and Super Cute Clean Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideWomen
Reviews.Content: This is my first time ever writing a review for a hotel so please excuse me if I do not use the correct verbage. I travelled to San Diego (SD) for business in February for a two month stay. Two months away from friends and family is awful enough without mentioning staying at a hotel for the entire time. When I first found out that I was travelling to SD, I queried coworkers for the best in town and called around to a few. Someone suggested Marriott in the Gaslamp. From the beginning, the staff was extremely helpful with the booking, identifying nearby attractions and even suggesting placing a refrigerator and microwave in my room so I wouldn't get too fat during my stay. But, the refrigator didn't totally stop me from strolling around and grabbing bites to eat at one or two out of maybe a thousand resturants within walking distance of the hotel (okay, maybe a little over one hundred resturants). If it wasn't for the fact that I was there for work and my office wasn't downtown, I would not have ever left the Gaslamp! Everything was right there: movies, shopping, Amercian food, Thai food, Chinese food, Sushi, a Westin's Mall, the baseball stadium). 24 hour gym helps get the pounds away too. Did I mention the amazing view of the city from the Altitude Lounge ( Can you say rooftop to the 100th power? ) Awesome View! Additionally, the hotel's free internet and printing made my wedding planning away from home smooth. Running out of time here...but I want to stress that the hotel was super CLEAN, staff was extremely helpful with whatever I needed and I would definitely stay there again and suggest it to all my family and friends. This hotel was definitely a model for what other hotels should strive for...

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Staff & the accomodations were First Class”
Reviews.Author: jimatp
Reviews.Content: I think the hotels location right inside the Gaslamp district was great. Add to this the great accommodations, the roof top bar and most importantly the staff it made a long week a great week. I actually commented to my colleague who was traveling with me that the entire staff was polite, friendly and so helpful. I am a Marriott customer and always happy with my stay but this was above and beyond and a perfect model for a very successful hotel. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Unique Marriott - Great location, awesome rooms”
Reviews.Author: cakmeh0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a phenomenal spot. Literally across the street from Petco Field, in the heart of the coolest restaurant district in the entire USA. Rooms are not only up to date, but remarkably upscale versus an average Marriott. Great design, upgraded bathroom amenities with spa quality toiletries. Even arriving at the front desk was a cool experience, with locally made Salt Water taffy available when you check in. If you're lucky enough to get concierge access, there is a stunning view of baseball field as well - best seat in the hosue! Very cool place - look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “This Marriott has the best roof-top! Great view of the City and Petco Field!”
Reviews.Author: GTHunter
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this Marriott....great location in the city and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The best team to work with”
Reviews.Author: tiffanywilson84
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott where my company hosted our regional meeting. From the begining Lindsey and her team were a dream to work with. I don't know how many emails we shared back and forth, and she made every little change necessary much to our satisfaction. When we arrived the hotel was even better than the pictures. The staff worked endlessly to provide all of our needs. I only hope that other Marriott properties will be the same, as they have set the bar high for our next meeting. I am a loyal Marriott customer, and this exceeded all of my expectations. Thanks again to the even comittee and everyone that worked to help our meeting be "The Best Yet" and that is quoting our VP. Thanks so much

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott property in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: MrPat612
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - you can see into Petco Park from your room. Staff is intelligent, friendly and they care about doing things right. Rooms are comfortable, the view is great, the beds are fantastic, A/C works well, water is hot, internet speed is excellent, HD TV - what's not to like?!?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: KarmelDST
Reviews.Content: This really isn't a hotel for small children. Everything within the hotel was absolutely wonderful. Check in was a breeze. When we got to our room my hubby commented on how nice it was. Unfortunately, I had to call the front desk to see if there was a room with two double beds available so that our son would have a place to sleep. They did have one and switched us with no problem. This new room was a little smaller vut still nice. Everyone in the hotel was very nice and accommodating. Check out was just as easy and we were very pleased that the very expensive valet parking was included in my AAA rate. I chose this hotel because the website said how close it was to Sea World and that was the purpose of our trip. It was very close, however, the Gaslamp district is not very accommodating to children. It's more for the party goers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sbaker317
Reviews.Content: I get to San Diego very often, but had not stayed here until this week. I had a great stay and will stay here again. The hotel and location were great, at a surprisingly affordable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at the Gaslamp with birds' eye view of San Diego Padre games!”
Reviews.Author: NCBecky
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Marriott Gaslamp where my husband was attending a convention. We have been to San Diego other times but never stayed here. This is a wonderful hotel, location, service, rooms, cleanliness , everything! We were on the concierge floor and even could watch the Padre games being played at Petco Park. How neat was that!
