Reviews.Content: This location was unbeatable. It was a few blocks away from the convention center and right in the heart of the gaslamp district. When I checked into the hotel, I asked for a quiet room. They checked thru the rooms and ended up upgrading me to a junior suite. The suite was beautiful and this enhanced my stay. The bathroom was done in marble and had very nice amenities. The king sized bed was incredibly comfortable. The room was very clean. As a bonus, there was a huge bowl of chocolate kisses at the front desk that is never empty for the hotel guests. There are actually 3 candy bowls, but I only cared about the chocolate. The roof top of the hotel is the bar that has a perfect view of the ball field. On a chilly night, you can sit next to the fire pit , order a glass of wine from the bar and a plate of cheese from the kitchen. It doesn't get any better than that! I can't remember the young bartenders name but he was exceptionally nice. When I told him I was on my own that night, he bought me a glass of wine. I loved the roof top experience. It's a great way to unwind after working all day. Staying at the Gaslamp Marriot made my stay more of an adventure. It was so easy to get around. I never felt unsafe which made exploring the area even more enjoyable. There is also a free computer to use on the 6th floor. Everyone at the Gaslamp was friendy and very helpful. Later in the week, I moved to another hotel (not the Marriot) to another location downtown. Downtown has a completely different feel to it. Sadly there are many homeless people downtown. That part of the city feels very different than the Gaslamp District, even though it's only about 10 blocks away. I really missed staying at the Marriot. I would say this was my favorite Marriot hotel. I couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: name_screen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott Gaslamp Quarter for a long weekend visit to San Diego in March 2009. Excellent location for walking distance to Gaslamp Quarter restaurants, bars, galleries, and shops. Our room had a view of PetCo Park. The swanky rooftop bar is worth visiting and on a Saturday night, there is a long line for non-guests to go there. We had a spacious king room (hotel was non-smoking) including large in-room safe (large enough for a laptop), coffee maker, hair dryer, and excellent toiletries. Hotel is also short distance from convention center. Would recommend for leisure or work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: cc41
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in October for sightseeing and Patriots game. Very nice hotel, awesome location - like most 4* hotels, no free amenities - example internet use $14 for 15minutes!!! Parking is $30 with in/out. Garage directly in front of hotel is $15 day but no in/out. They do have excellent coffee in the lobby in the am and we thought the staff was very pleasant especially the valet for the 1 night we parked there. The rooftop bar is very cool in the evening. Great view but gets very club-like at night and the staff has a bit of an attitude, also predictably pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Talldarkhandsomest
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night using our Marriott points from our timeshare. The location is terrific, right on coronado bay and in the heart of the Gaslamp district. There were many great restaurants nearby and we had dinner at Royal Thai which was just a block away. Inexpensive, delicious and authentic. Also, when it's baseball season you could practically watch the Padres play from the rooftop bar as you look directly down onto Petco Park. The rooms are clean, moderately sized with upscale bathrooms that include marbel counter tops. The overall feel of the property is upscale and the service at check in and valet were prompt, courteous, and professional. We also used room service twice; late at night and for breakfast and each time I was frankly amazed at the speed of service--about 15 minutes. Food and presentation was very good. We did not go to the onsite restaurant but we did go to the rooftop bar which has great views and a large firepit. Located just off the rooftop bar is the gym which we glanced at--pretty good for a Marriott. Enjoy yourself and contact if you wish, this place is definitely up to snuff! PS: I travel all the time and stay at 4-5 star resorts most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, weekend was noisy”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriott Gaslamp for two nights at the end of a trip to San Diego visiting friends. The first night was a Saturday and the hallway noise was so loud, with people going in and out of their rooms and (I assume) back up to the bar on the roof. Typical drunk people making a lot of noise. I was supposed to get up early for a flight, but the noise made sleeping impossible and I decided at 3am to call the airline and change my flight home and stop stressing about the sleep. Gave me an extra day in San Diego. The location as others have said is great. Would be perfect for baseball. The front staff I delt with were just ok (always seemed to have their own conversations going on while they were helping me, which isn't great service), couldn't get a bellhop to help with my luggage (again talking to other workers), but the bartenders in the streetside bar were very nice and made great drinks. Rooms very comfortable; linens, mattress, etc. Nice bathroom. Good Sunday brunch. I have stayed at nicer hotels in downtown San Diego, but weekend web rate was a decent one, and I was glad I didn't pay more with the bad first night! Second night, which was a Sunday, was very quiet in the hotel. Would only stay here again with a really good rate or for Padres game due the noise and lack of attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Decor and Beautiful Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AZPenguin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a basic room. Very beautifully decorated with large flat screen TV. Bathrooms are really nicely decorated. Large closet with mirror. Beds were comfortable. Stayed on the 18th floor and I was very happy to see that I could open the windows slightly for fresh air. Free WiFi in the lobby. Even if there isn't a baseball game going on, it's worth a trip up to the 22nd floor to check out the rooftop views. You can perfectly see the diamond of PetcoPark (it's right across the road). It was a little pricey for the night and only valet parking was available. Free brewed Starbucks coffee in the mornings in the lobby. Close to tons of restaurants and bars in the Gaslamp district (which is open and there's people out every night of the week) and there's a Subway just across from the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: DAGK
Reviews.Content: two nights at the Marriott. convenient location for cruising the gaslamp and for checking out a ball game if you're so inclined. Valet parking and check in were quick and efficient. room's have been recently renovated and had some nice touches. a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better for baseball fans than for business trips”
Reviews.Author: nhunixguy
Reviews.Content: If you're in San Diego to see the Padres, this Marriott is where you want to stay. If you're here for a convention at the convention center, it's a short and pleasant walk. Beyond that, the hotel has its good and bad points. First, the good points: this hotel is at the edge of the Gaslamp district. There are endless restaurants, bars, shopping, or whatever touristy diversion you could want. Second, there's Colleen (hope I remember that right) at the front desk. If you have a problem, she'll fix it. It's also a very quiet hotel unless you have noisy neighbors like I did on 1 of 3 nights. Unlike the Hyatt, you'll never hear the trolley because it doesn't run next to the hotel and that's a good thing unless you plan on using it. There's a coffee maker, a hair dryer, and all of the usual toiletries. Hot water came up pretty fast except on the day when I got up at 4AM to catch an early flight. Then it took a few minutes for the shower to get up to temperature. Not everything was perfect and I found more problems than I would have expected in a hotel that's so highly rated here. First, realize that all of the hotel's rooms were not created equal. The first room they gave me was on the 9th floor. It looked like a basement apartment because the windows started halfway up the wall, and the glass was frosted so you couldn't see out of the room. Fortunately the windows opened far enough for me to see what they were hiding and it was a roof with some kind of equipment on it. Maybe they weren't noisy air conditioning compressors that I saw, but I didn't want to find out. I went back to the lobby and got switched to room 1701 with a view of Petco park that was just like the ones in the traveler photos here. Another problem is that you can't get to your room without using your key card in the elevator to allow access to the guest floors. It's a nice security feature but when you get into the elevator with both hands full of luggage, it's a bit silly. There's a bar on the roof that's open to the public and at night they block off one of the four elevators for roof access only. There's always a crowd in the way, the three other elevators become busier and slower than ever, etc. And this is when it's not baseball season. The roof bar looks down on the stadium so during a game this elevator situation can't be fun for guests in the lobby. I think the roof bar is probably a good reason to avoid staying on the top floor, but that's just a guess. Finally there's the high speed internet access. First you have to call downstairs. Then you have to tell them if you want wireless or an ethernet connection. After you say "Wireless", they tell you that you'll need to give your credit card number to some company that you've never heard of. And if you want to use a cable to connect, the charge can go on your bill. Once you try to use it, you go through a screen that basically says "Your only choice is 24 hours of broadband. What would you like to choose?" You have to do this every 24 hours or you can skip a day if you'd like. Upon checkout you'll discover that after you pick the 24 hour "option", you get billed for this automatically every day until you check out. One good thing is that along with the internet, you also get free domestic calls, local or long distance. I'm not sure how much people actually use the phone in their room for long distance calls, but it seems like a reasonable way to call home once you realize it's free. The system doesn't seem to be well thought out. I think they'd make more money if the rooms were $3/night more and there was free wifi, but I'm not in the hotel business. I just stay in hotels. Overall, I had a good time at the Marriott. It wasn't as nice of a hotel at the Hyatt and there were ar too many small problems, but this would be my number one pick if I was in town to see the Padres.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sb631
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a conference. What a great choice. Just over one short block to the convention center and across the street from Petco Park. This is right in the middle of a great area full of eateries and excellent walking adventures. If you like walking you are within easy reach of the bay, the Midway and many other great locations. The room was large, very clean and quite comfortable. They have a great concierge lounge as well. The location of this hotel made me the envy of my peers attending the conference who were staying elsewhere. It was pricey but it appeard so wasn't the rest of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jasonb21
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel I would stay at whenever I come to San Diego. By far the best hotel in the whole of San Diego. Great Location, tidy rooms and friendly staff members. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: maphopper
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Right across from Petco Park, and it's very convenient to the happenings in the downtown area. Parking is expensive. Good roof-top bar with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: WSmile5
Reviews.Content: Great place near lots. Attended convention, rode trollies & buses, feasted-whats not to like. Hotel adjacent to Petco Park which was not a factor as it was post-season during our visit. Staff was very helpful, lobby is hip, room was big w/sofa & 2 flat-screens & fine view of Petco+bay. Only drawback: no pool. Moved to Omni after 4 nights here; Marriott room was bigger, nicer, cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch Marriott”
Reviews.Author: veeRob
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. Marriott's can be hit and miss, but this one was top notch. The front desk staff was very helpful, though I did have problems with nobody picking up the phone when calling down from my room. The front desk had a bunch of rad candy to steal, so our stay was Pixy Stix'ed up. I got lucky, too, because I was able to book this hotel for around $100 on priceline.com. Only complaint was the $30/night for valet when I figured out after that I could have parked in the same lot they used for $16/24 hours. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CA2PHX
Reviews.Content: spent 2 nights at this hotel and loved every minute. The service from the Front Desk, Bellstand and Resturaunt was fantastic. I was most impressed with the food. Room Service and the resturant in the lobby dished up very creative options! Try the spinich/mushroom/shrimp quesadilla from room service - YUM! The room was quite comfortable...bed was great. Oh...and the best part....part of the bathroom amenities was a shower puff!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Goulz
Reviews.Content: Got a room for 130$ using Priceline. Spacious, clean, recent, great view, I am short of superlatives regarding the room itself. Water pressure was great in the shower, Internet access worked great (wired) and it had a lot of space. The bathroom was superb (with marble and a sliding door!). Went to the Altitude bar on the 22nd floor right before the game, the drinks were good and the price was ok. Couldn't sleep with the windows open because of the noise, but soundproof windows and A/C did the trick. Had breakfast delivered at 6:00 AM (the earliest). It was a tad on the cold side.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: csc1818
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days at the end of August for vacation and was very pleased. The hotel is simple but clean, rooms are average sized with all the necessary amenities. You're right in the Gaslamp Quarter next to great bars and restaurants. If you're bringing a car, park in the lot around the corner for $11 a night (the hotel charges $30+). All in all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a baseball fan”
Reviews.Author: calgal99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a weekend's stay at the Marriott Gaslamp. As our primary reason for visiting San Diego was to watch a couple of baseball games at Petco Park, I would definitely recommend this hotel to any other baseball fans. Their service was top notch. We arrived at 9 am and expected to be told to come back at 3 pm to check in but the front desk already had a room ready for us. In addition, when we were ready to depart, their doorsmen ran a block to flag down a taxi for us in hectic post-game traffic. The rooms are clean and spacious and many have outstanding views of the ballpark or the San Diego skyline. There was also complimentary bottled water in the room. For dining options, the restaurant downstairs, Soleil @ K, has a fantastic breakfast buffet for $18. There is also a beautiful, albeit pricey, rooptop bar as well that allows you to look into the ballpark across the street. I'm sure we'll be back again to watch more ballgames (by the way, the walk from the front door to Petco Park is about 2-3 minutes!), we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jtaefy
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was truely excellent. It was beautifully appointed both in the common areas as well as in the room. Well cared for by the attentive staff. I would say this qualified as one of my Favorite hotel stays in many moons. Beautiful sceneries from the rooms. Only thing missing is a pool, and if you're planning on having folks come visit, or meeting people there, parking is a bit of a headache/expense. But if you aim to hang out in Gaslamp district or take in a ball game... I can't imagine a better place to do it. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp for two nights in July as part of a business personal trip. We loved this hotel! Check in was very smooth and there were lots of little candies on the counter which was a nice treat. We had a room on the 19th floor that was spacious and clean. The TV had multiple channels to choose from while we were in the room. The bath had all the normal amenities which was nice. We went to the rooftop bar both evenings and really enjoyed it- the view is nice, the set up is nice, the bartenders are even nice. The location was great too- we walked multiple places and enjoyed being close to a lot of places. We parked in a public garage right across from the hotel to save on valet. Check out was smooth as well. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pleased”
Reviews.Author: CACountrygirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at Marriott Gaslamp Quarter. Paid $229 per night for water view king standard room with AAA rate. This hotel has plenty of positive things going for it. Friendly & helpful staff greeting us by the curb and at the check in counter. Beautiful hotel throughout & doesn't feel like a chain hotel - very updated and modern for a Marriott. The best thing about this hotel is the LOCATION. Across the street from Padres stadium. We could see the people in the stands from our 18th floor room. One block from 5th Avenue, three blocks from Convention center & a nice 20 minute(?) walk to USS Midway. A few blocks away from Cafe 222.....very good breakfast place. The room itself was standard in size - just room enough for a wing chair with ottoman next to the king bed plus a desk with chair. The bedding and room finishes were very high-end and modern. The bathroom was not large but it also had nice high-end finishes that made up for it. The curved shower curtain rod was nice. The only gripe as far as the room goes is that we ran out of toilet paper on the morning we were to check out - thank goodness for kleenex. They never left us another roll after the initial extra roll at check in. That should never happen - how hard is it to start off stocking a couple of extra rolls just in case!? We were pleased overall with our stay and would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip @ Convention Ctr”
Reviews.Author: wayneinwisc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Gaslamp Square District downtown, just a few blocks from the Convention Center where my company was having meetings all week. Only about 3 blocks away-easy walking. Hotel is not your typical Marriott, was a former Clarion Hotel, which was turned into a Marriott about 5 yrs ago. So, the walls are a bit thin, and you can hear lould guests if it is crowded. The staff was very friendly and helpful, free business center with computers, printers, and Internet access.Has had the Marriott upgrade on bedding, which is great. Hall carpeting is a bit worn, but a great value if you need to stay near here for a business mtg. Exercise room on rooftop was good! No pool or whirlpool on property. Only negative was housekeeping ,seems to do a very rushed job and beware of the drinking glasses. Mine were never cleaned properly (washed in a dishwasher), and it appears they were just wiped out. I had some extra time one day and observed one housekeeper clean serveral rooms close to mine. Never did I see her get clean glasses from her cart or take away the dirty ones. Use you own paper cup-I did and it was OK. Be careful of the coffee mugs, I filled mine with water and some film was visible on the water. (ugh). I would stay here again if business required it, as it was considerable less expensive than nearby hotels

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Marriott”
Reviews.Author: se2121
Reviews.Content: I try to stay at Marriotts as often as I can on vacation for the simple fact that they are wonderful but this hotel far exceeded my expectations. I would have to say that this is probably the best Marriott experience I have had in quite a while. Check-in was quick and all the employees are extremely friendly, but not a fake friendly, more of a sincere "thanks for staying with us" friendly. The room that we got was a HUGE room with a seperate sitting area. We must have gotten upgraded to a suite but it was awesome. Great view of the Petco stadium. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom was well appointed. As I mentioned about the employees, I have never met more friendly and helpful Valet Attendants before in my life. One morning prior to leaving the hotel for a run, I asked where I could find a drug store at which time all 3 employees outside provided me with at least 8 different ones within my running path. Can't say enough about the friendly employees. The restaurant in the hotel was wonderful. A bit pricey but not bad at all. The gym was a typical hotel gym with several treadmills, free weights (low weights though), and a couple other machines. The hotel, as many others have written, is at the base of the Gaslamp Quarter District. It is literally on the corner of the district and you only have to walk a couple blocks to get to the end of it so within these few blocks, you have wonderful restaurants and bars. The close proximity would please any age group whether you want to just have an early dinner or stay out and drink all night. You are also directly across the street from Petco Stadium which is awesome. I recommend buying the $5.00 standing room only tickets as we did if you are going to a game. You can see the game from anywhere around the stadium and it lets you get a different aspect from the different spots. If you don't want to go to the game, you can watch it from the rooftop bar which was pretty cool. Rather expensive but a must see. If I return to San Diego, I would only stay here and would tell anyone that is traveling to San Diego to stay here. Great for all age groups and only a couple minutes away from the highway and about 10 minutes away from the major tourist attractions. Well done Marriott!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only missing element was a swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Tristanski
Reviews.Content: For a romantice getaway weekend, we were looking for a warm location where we could relax. My wife loves to sit by the pool and read magazines. I looked up on TripAdvisor a few options in the gaslamp district because we were intending on only walking. We were not coming to see the sights. At first, we looked only at hotels with a pool. But found that many did not. Next, we looked at the other benefits. I loved the lobby pics of the Marriott, and then I saw the rooftop fireplace with couches. I suggested that we could also sit there and read magazines. She bought it. In fact, we did enjoy the rooftop lounge on our trip, both during the day and at night. Our room view was spectacular, facing the ocean and north towards downtown. The conceirge lounge on the top floor saved us many trips to oustide spots to grab snacks and drinks - we loved it! And the concierge helped us search out some great restaurants. She was very nice as well. This hotel definately fullfilled our expectations and we had a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cdub100
Reviews.Content: The wife and I took our anniversary trip to San Diego. We chose this hotel because it was in the middle of everything and you know what you're going to get with Marriott. The hotel it self was beautiful and the staff very helpful and friendly. The only thing I didn't like was this hotel did not have a pool. Of course we knew that going in, but I highly underestimated how relaxing a dip in the pool can be after walking around all day. The hotel also has a very active night club and a first rate restaurant. If you're a budget traveler there's a subway located across the street that also serves breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Great!”
Reviews.Author: DrHickenlocher
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest Marriotts I've ever stayed at, and I've been to a few dozen. Everything seemed pretty new. The room was clean, fresh, and very pleasant. The bed was standard Marriott plushness. The TV worked fine (although it was a standard flat-screen CRT, not an LCD). The bathroom was well-stocked and water pressure was pretty good on the 16th floor. Two caveats: One, there's no mini-fridge in the room. This was kind of annoying since we had a few of our own bottles of water and it was like 95 degrees out that weekend. And two, hallway noise seemed a little louder than usual for a Marriott. We could hear quite a bit of activity whenever people would walk back and forth. The front desk staff were very nice (Kirby was pretty cool). The only issue was that when we arrived at 5pm, there was only one front desk clerk and like 4 or 5 people backed up in line. We waited for about five minutes but then 2 additional front desk staff showed up and we got checked in quickly. But where were those 2 staffers for the first five minutes? The location, also, is excellent. You can actually SEE the infield at Petco from the rooftop bar. But be aware that the streets will get a little crowded if you visit during a home game. And the Gaslamp Quarter is right around the corner with a TON of bars and restaurants. If we ever returned to the area, I'd probably stay at the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the convention center”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: As usual, the trip to San Diego was for a convention, and this Marriott is in a good location for the convention center - albeit not next door like the original Marriott. It was clean and quiet, and the staff were all polite. Check in and check out were quick. The rooftop bar gets alot of use - mainly by young locals, it seems - but that did not disturb me. I would recommend this hotel to conventioneers and others visiting downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Modern yet very comfy”
Reviews.Author: Cyclone94
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - and I'm usually a little picky. When I walked into the ultra modern and chic lobby I thought the rooms would be very modern but many times that means small in a downtown hotel. I was wrong, I was very impressed with the space in our room. We had 2 double beds. I found the beds very comfortable. The staff is some of the friendliest I've every been around, actaully we were impressed with the friendly atmosphere of the whole city! Parking was expensive, as in any big downtown city, so we expected that. I would absolutely stay back here if I got back to SD.

Reviews.Title: “terrific with a hiccup”
Reviews.Author: the rocklander
Reviews.Content: Just a great locale in the heart of the Ballpark and Gas Lamp district. Steps from Petco field and just 2 blocks from the harbor side entry into the Gas Lamp district. The front desk staff were great. Full of enthusiasm and cheerfully responding to any need. The hotel is modern and the beds were fabulous. Our room overlooked the ballpark with great city views. The room itself was well maintained and the bath spotless with handome tiles. We had breakfast delivered daily to our room - it was very timely and very large servings provided. Drinks on the rooftop bar are expensive but in line with any other hotel bar prices. The restaurant has a limited menu but is very nicely situated off the hotel lobby. The sidewalk bar was okay but we found the service a bit off. The concierge in the lobby was nowhere to be found however the front desk and bell staff were able to answer any question we had. The only downside we found was with the maid service. They serviced the room as expected during the day however we had to consistently call down to the front desk during our stay to request replenishment of bathsoap, mouthwash, even toilet paper. The maid staff somehow never replaced anything? We've travelled everywhere and never experienced anything like this oversight!

Reviews.Title: “a good reliable place -- but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: rosstucker
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Gaslamp is a well-run hotel in all aspects. However, it is rather expensive -- even for a quality chain hotel. Perhaps its proximity to Petco Park (home of the San Diego Padres) is the reason...but almost $400 a night (including the taxes) seems a bit steep. (This was the internet rate.) The room was a big one -- with all the facilities. Breakfast is extra -- but it is a good buffet breakfast with lots of choice (about $40 for two people), Valet parking ($30 per night) also seems a bit much. (We parked in a garage across the street.) The staff were very considerate and helpful; it was they who suggested parking across the street to save the outrageous valet parking fee. So -- if you are willing to pay such a price, it's a good hotel! And -- it is in a convenient location -- the Gaslamp Quarter is within easy walking distance --with lots of good restaurants and interesting streetscapes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel to Major Attractions”
Reviews.Author: kevboom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a major conference. It sits downtown, across the highway from the San Diego Convention Center. I am usually not a fan of Marriott Hotels, but this particular location was well appointed. The hotel definitely had a boutique feel from the lobby to the modern rooms. The negatives to this hotel would be the lack of a pool and the restaurant which is overpriced. We received a pass to swim at the Marriott Towers nearby on the water, but it was a good 6+ block walk in a swimsuit and that pool was so packed with people you couldn't move. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant (only once), which was more than $10 for a danish and orange juice about the same quality as the 7-11 sells for $1.49. We never made it to the rooftop bar, but I understand that is quite popular during the evening. Fortunately the hotel sits at the beginning of the Gaslamp Quarter, so you can walk to many nearby restaurants that cost less and taste better than the hotel food. Probably the best reason to stay at this hotel is to see a San Diego Padres baseball game. Their beautiful new stadium sits right next to this hotel, so you can definitely walk over and enjoy all the beer you want before safely returning to your room. This hotel had valet parking, but we were also allowed to self-park at the garage directly across the street and had no problem with that. Easy to access, except maybe on a game day. Besides walking to the Gaslamp Quarter, you can also walk 4 or so blocks from this hotel to the convention center and a bit farther down the water to Seaport Village for more shopping. You wouldn't really need a car at this hotel to see several major downtown attractions, but it's good to have one for going out to Balboa Park, the zoo, Seaworld, Old Town, the beaches, etc. If you can get a good rate at this hotel, book it. Can't imagine anything more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: auntiecoco
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything the business traveler needs and then some. The complex is enormous, with restaurants, shops, gym, etc. -- you'd never really need to leave the hotel except right outside the door is the fabulous gas lamp district with great food, bars & shopping. on the other side of the hotel is the harbor and a running/bike path. i had a harbor view and and a very large room. it seemed to be a very family friendly establishment, as well.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuchToronto
Reviews.Content: Great rate achieved through priceLine, received a room of suite proportions, front office staff very helpful, the hotel actually exceeded expectations, and is very well situated in downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, Recommended”
Reviews.Author: RichardofAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was a pleasant experience. The staff was friendly and attentive, the building was new and very well kept. The rooms were spacious and well furnished and the bathrooms were really quite large. The view from the upper floors is very good and it is also very quiet on these floors. The concierge service is helpful and the hotel does offer valet parking at a rate that is a little bit higher than the area warrants. From the hotel you are in good walking distance of everything you might need. The water is close. The trolley/train is nearby too, which is very nice and convenient. You are also in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter, which while touristy is also fun. There are good restaurants in the area, including some nice Irish pubs a fabulous Indian restaurant called Bombay. About a mile in to the town is also a large shopping mall. The only downfall of the hotel is its restaurant and bars. The bars are overpriced, even for such an area ($7 for a beer) and I couldn't get a decent vodka martini at either one. There are two; one at the lobby level and one on the roof. The one on the roof has a great view, especially at dusk and allows smoking, but still, couldn't get a good drink. The restaurant is also dud. It claims to be serving some sort of authentic Californian cuisine. No offense to California, but if that's authentic California cuisne, I don't want any. It's almost entirely vegetarian, which is fine, but it's all very odd concoctions, none of which really seem to work (I tried several during my stay, trying to be open minded and such) and they put a lot of emphasis on the display "food as art" kind of presentation. Aside from those two faults, the Marriott Gaslamp Quarter is a very good hotel. There is another Marriott about three blocks from it, the one with the convention center on the water. I personally liked the Gaslamp Quarter better. It's more intimate, the service is better and it's smaller and not as busy and loud. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice.”
Reviews.Author: msmalibu
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Marriott now sends out multiple emails reminding you about your reservation and asking if you have any special requests. I made some requests and got multiple emails confirming my requests. One of the requests was a quiet room, and the room they gave me was just above a lot of humming air conditioning equipment. The other request I made also was not done. I went down to let them know their system wasn't working and was directed to a manager. He apologized and gave us an upgrade to a room on the concierge floor - a very quiet room with a view of the ocean at the end of a hallway. I felt this was a very generous upgrade as the concierge floor guests get free breakfast and snacks and coffee all day and a nice lounge to hang out in. We really enjoyed that room and the perks. If you have a similar experience and your requests are not honored, let them know! As far as the room itself, it was very clean, very new, great bed and bedding -- overall extremely comfortable. (The room on the concierge floor was identical to the first room we were given, except it had a bigger desk.) The hotel is a couple of blocks from the train tracks and we found that the train noise was not a problem. We parked in a garage nearby on 6th St. for $18, vs. the $28 the hotel charges. The location is very convenient to the convention center (two blocks) and to the restaurants and clubs on 5th St. No fridge in the rooms but apparently you can request one. This was not a problem for us. We had a group/convention rate of $209 which was reasonable for this area. I would definitely stay here again if I attend another event at the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott Ever”
Reviews.Author: debtaylor
Reviews.Content: The area is great, view wonderful. However, all I was trying to do was give my Firefighter husband a nice restful weekend after fighting all the California wildfires. Boy was that not going to happen. Our first night, I finally called the front desk at 1:00am to report the PARTY that was going on in the next room. Guest Service came up 1/2 hour later to knock on their door. The PARTY continued until around 3:00am, when I again had to call the front desk to report the party. The next night, around 2:00am our phone rang and when we picked up the phone the person said it was the front desk. When we asked what they wanted they just hung up. Ten minutes later the phone rang again with the same response. After checking out, I also found that they double charged me on the valet parking, for a total of $56.00 per day instead of the $28.00 as indicated on the website. I stay at Marriott's all over the country, and will not stay at this one again. It was very disappoining,

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriot GasLamp”
Reviews.Author: texasboy57
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six day stay at the Marriot GasLamp. We stayed on the Concierge floor which meant we had not only a very large, clean room with an outstanding view of Petco Field and the water, but also more of a buffet breakfast than the usual continental offerings. The staff was very gracious. They really made you feel welcome. And they had a bartender in the lobby bar who was a whirl of motion, but took the time to create a margarita for my wife , who is diabetic, that didn't have as much sugar as a conventional one. Muchas gracias, Livierna. When we return to San Diego to visit friends we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Home-in-TX
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Marriott Gaslamp. We were made to feel welcome and appreciated by all staff members we encountered during our stay. Checked in on a Sunday and out on a Friday. Had a water view room on the 17th floor and it had a great view of the Omni next door! We could also see the water and Petco Park but I'm not sure the water view rooms are worth the extra money. There were no ballgames during the week so it was very quiet around the area where the Marriott is located. The only complaint is that noise is easily heard through the interior door of rooms that are adjoining as ours was. It was only an issue on the last day of our stay. Parked across the street at the Ace parking garage and averaged about $10 per day in parking fees. It was very convenient being directly across from the hotel entrance. Food at the hotel is okay but would recommend eating elsewhere. Great breakfast a few blocks and an easy walk to Cafe 222 located at 2nd & Island. Also great Thai food at Rama which is only a couple of blocks away. You really don't need a car if you plan to stay in the downtown area as most everything you'll need is an easy walk from the hotel. Went to rooftop bar Altitude on our first day at the hotel. There was an afternoon game at Petco Park and the bar was packed. It's a good spot if you are a twenty-something, but at 38 I felt extremely old at the place. A reviewer recently wrote about the floors at the hotel not being level. I did see what they were referring to throughout the hotel including hallway and room, but they are blowing it way out of proportion. There is nothing about it that should make you feel unsafe at the hotel. If I needed to stay in downtown SD I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: superfila
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Priceline for $100.00 Sun-Mon in Sep/Oct. I'm usually a little leery of Marriott's in general, but all I can say about the Marriott Gaslamp is wow! Outstanding property, doesn't even look like a typical Marriott... think something closer to an upscale W Hotel. Extra comfy bed and pillow, basically identical to the Westin Heavenly Bed, a large L-shaped desk for business, generous sitting area, elegantly appointed bathroom with granite counter, nicely tiled floor, marble-like paneling, comfy towels, generous amenities. Big TV, maybe a 28" flat tube? Lots of cherry wood tones thruout the room and property. Walking distance to all the great restaurants and shops in the Gaslamp Quarter. I am staying here from now on when I visit San Diego, especially at the rate I got. Some minor downers... almost nonexistant dessert menu (guess I can overlook that for the price), $28 valet parking (easy to remedy.. self-park across the street for $8 overnight and walk 100 ft across the street to the Marriott lobby). If more Marriotts start to look like this one, I'm switching chains!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: simonharris
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to San Diego i have stayed in a number of hotels in the area. Check in was quick and efficient and my requested room with a water view led me to a wonderful rooom with great views over the water and Pecto Park. The room was large and very comfortable and my fears about noise from the game at Pecto Park keeping me awake were ill founded as the glazing on the windows gave me the uninterupted sleep i was after.All the staff i had dealings with were friendly and efficient ( UK staff take note) and the breakfast buffet was a great way to start the day.The location, the accommodation and staff mean that i will definitely return when i am back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations, service, hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAMiller
Reviews.Content: Michael A. Miller - 8/22-23/07 This is just an excellent hotel, no compromise in accommodations, hospitality, and general staff. Location is perfect for transportation and walking if you choose. Close to airport. Food is excellent as are hotel services.

Reviews.Title: “Not so splendid stay....”
Reviews.Author: Summerlyn4
Reviews.Content: I have read through previous reviews and I am surprised that I am the first to comment on the UNEVEN flooring. The first room that we checked in to had two double beds, and who wants to sleep in separate beds when celebrating an anniversary?! So, they moved us to our SECOND room. As we walked in to the second room, I told me husband that I felt as though I was experiencing vertigo, then it became clear as to why…The floor was completely uneven. To walk from the main entrance to the window, was an uphill climb. The floor was so uneven, that you could sit on the bed and see that the TV armoire was sloping. It was hard enough to see the TV from the bed, but then you had to battle with the downward slope. We called down and expressed our concern, they pretended like they had never heard of such a thing. So, on to room number THREE. Same thing…just as bad as the second room, only this time, we could actually stand in the hallway of the floor and see that the entire floor was uneven. It was clearly obvious that something was wrong….So, we called down to the front desk again. At this point, we could tell that the poorly trained, unenthusiastic front desk staff was getting irritated. However, they moved us to room number FOUR. Upon arrival, we realized that all the rooms were screwed up, and that we should just make do. We spoke with two food servers that explained to us that all the rooms are like that. Wow, who built this place?!

Reviews.Title: “Located for walking”
Reviews.Author: Mary97370
Reviews.Content: This hotel was central to most all our activities. We walked almost everywhere. We were in a corner junior suite and had no problems with noise. Walking across the street to Petco was great. We ate in the Gaslamp area almost every day. The room was large, as you'd expect in a junior suite, offering two different views and a marble bathroom. There were two tvs including a large flat screen on the living room side. Staff was friendly and the candy on the counter was a treat. The only negative was no refrigerator/honor bar in the room. Room service was tasty, on time (breakfast) and fast (late evening snack). The harbor is a short walk away. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Once more a good review”
Reviews.Author: tedandlisa90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel July 16,17 . We were in town specifically to see the Mets play the Padres at Petco Park since we have been to this same hotel once before we were prepared at what to expect. Parking- We pulled up to their Valet and parked our car with them. We've done this before and were willing to pay the 28.00 daily rate went up BTW from last years 24.00 no problems though fast and curteous. Check -in - Easy and fast no problems. Room- We had a room facing the building directly across from the Marriott but also had a beautiful view of the water and Petco Park. I guess we were in a premium room that was somewhat larger and most updated to ones on lower levels. We were on the 17 floor (1716) and anything higher than that requires the key for the elevator. The room was bigger than a lower floor we had before and the decor looked to be fairly new . Everything in modern city style the bathroom doors I noticed were pocket doors which helps with not taking up walking space in the entry. I forgot how small the double beds are here, they were comfortable but small. One thing that I had never heard ( I guess because we were on a lower floor last) of was when I called to get a roll- away for my child they said they could not give us one as we are above the 15 floor and roll-aways aren't allowed because of fire codes. That was new to me, but no big deal. My Husband and I ventured upstairs one night for a quick drink at the bar on the roof (Altitude) that I had wanted to visit before. Seems to be a very popular bar down in the Gaslamp. Was very busy with a weird but boisterous group of 40 somethings, young professionals, college age bar hoppers and convention people. The view and ambiance of the bar/club was very nice. I thought the drinks were very average but pricey for what you get. We each had 2 mojitos a piece plus tip and tax $58.00 total. We thought we were in Manhattan for a moment! Worth it there, but not for San Diego. Don't think I'd visit that bar again, once was enough. Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would stay again beacuse of the great location. Nothing beats being able to walk to the ballpark or all lthe great shops, restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: dinibell
Reviews.Content: If you are going for a ball game (you could throw a baseball into the park from your room!) or are just spending the weekend in one of the best areas in southern california, this is the place! Our room was very zen, clean, large and amenities very nice. (Never know if all rooms are equal - maybe b/c of our Marriott status they upgraded us - as we had to use our key in the elevator to access our floor). Beds were comfortable but not quite as excellent as other Marriotts have been. Front desk staff very inconsistent. Upon check in the guy was as professional and efficient as possible. Then, on our way out I asked a young woman behind the desk to order turn down service for our room and I sort of had the feeling I was talking to the wall and I was - it was never done. Also, concierge very untrained so either take your chances or do your homework before you go. We had heard that there was a Spanish restaurant nearby and he sent ous to a place that had paella on the menu but it was not only not "authentic style" but the place actually turns into a club and has "club food." There is a Persian restaurant that you shouldn't miss called Bondera. Have fun and soak up San Diego's Gaslamp district, go to Balboa Park and don't waste your time on the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dteacher
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. The walls are little thin. I heard the person next door get into the shower each morning. The beds are the best so it was easy to fall back asleep. The location is great. It can be a little pricey but I booked about a month in advance and got a good rate. We hung out at the Altitude bar on the day of a Padres game. We watched the game from the bar and had 1/2 price salad and turkey sandwich that was brought up from the Soleil restaurant. It was good and the price was right. The staff is friendly but I was a little frustrated on this visit to see the concierge desk empty frequently. One late afternoon I called to check on a restaurant and I had to leave a message. No one called me back until the next day. This is my second stay in a year and despite these little issues, I'll probably return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: GHB2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Gaslamp Marriott. We stayed over the 4th of July. The hotel is very nice and appears to be somewhat new. And like others have mentioned you cannot find a better place to stay if you are looking to go to a Padre Baseball game. The only meal we had at the hotel was breakfast which wasn’t bad for room service. I’m not sure of the price since it was given to us for free due to a 6am wake up call we received and didn’t request. Other than that the room was nice and was perfect in size for the two of us. We were on the 20th floor which overlooked the stadium and a portion of the bay. The bar on the rooftop was good and you could actually watch the game from the hotel and on the big screen TV’s they had. The hotel location is ideal if you plan on visiting the gaslamp area. I recommend doing so, there are so many restaurants and bars you would be hard pressed not finding something you will like. If anything there are too many to choose from. You are walking distance to the beach and marina area and the trolley is just a block away if you care to travel to the Old town area. The staff and concierge were all very helpful and friendly. Actually everyone at the hotel was very friendly. The concierge lounge could have been better but it wasn’t bad. Overall we really enjoyed the hotel and our 3 days there. We came back to our room one evening to find that our bed was turned down and had a snack and CD with soft music waiting for us. Although we couldn’t get the CD player to work it was definitely a nice touch and very thoughtful. We would stay here again and probably will when we visit San Diego again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mole
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marriott Gaslamp through Hotwire for $169 per night and we were really glad we did. We arrived via Amtrak from LA and transferred lines and took the trolley to the hotel. Extremely handy location only a few minutes walk from Gaslamp station. Check-in was quick and efficient with very well mannered staff. A very welcoming atmosphere and nice lobby area with bowls of candy (or lollies as we call them in Australia) on the counters. We were assigned a room on the 17th floor with view of the street area and the sea in the background. The rooms are very well planned and they have made good use of the amount of space available. Extremely well maintained with a very modern feel, large workdesk, easy chair with footrest and extremely comfortable bed. The bathroom was small but again well planned, lots of amenties and a coffee/tea maker. The business centre is open 24 hours a day and it was a nice surprise to find the internet access was free of charge. We ate in the restaurant one night and although it was not cheap the steak was 'to die for'. Location is fantastic, couple of minutes walk to the trolley and lots of restaurants nearby. There was a home game for the Padres each night we stayed (which my husband loved, even though Rugby Union is more our game!). Fantastic views into the stadium from the bar on the top level. The only negative is the lifts get very busy as the bar gets packed. We loved this hotel, it just had a really nice atmosphere as did the whole of San Diego. We had a great time and thought San Diego was a very pretty and interesting city and would definetly like to return in the future. I would have absoulutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for ball games, but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: LeisureErik
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in SD recently and stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp. The hotel has been newly rennovated and is one of the nicer Marriott's that I have stayed in. Hotel staff were friendly-- they were all wearing Padres uniforms, since there was a game that evening-- and courteous. They have jars of Tootsie rolls and bubble gum and other sweets at the front desk, which is a nice touch. There is a very popular bar on the rooftop (which offers a great veiw of the stadium) and as a result, the elevators can sometimes be slow. Also, all guests are required to insert their key card into the slot in the elevator to access their floor. This is a nice security measure, but slows things down. The rooms were quite large and my room had a nice view of the city. The only issue was that the walls were not as thick as I would have liked and I could hear my next door neighbors partying until late in the night. To be fair, the noise was faint and I am sure they were being extra loud. It sounded like there were several people in the room. The location is great. Petco field is a block away, so walking home after the ball game was easy. There are dozens of bars and restaurants nearby. My only "complaint" is very minor. I used the exercise room in the morning and found it to be quite small. They only had one eliptical trainer and some of the other equipment was pretty old. I would have expected better, given that the room was $299.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustMe00
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for business and then extended a few additional days with my husband. The room was very clean, as well as the bathroom. Upon check-in, the staff was very friendly and the valet staff asked if we needed directions every time we left. The room was a little cramped, due to excessive furniture, and we had a hard time seeing the television from the bed. It was impossible to lie in bed and watch television without propping yourself up on several pillows. If you're planning on going to Petco Park, this is the perfect hotel to stay at because the stadium entrance is 500 yards from the hotel. If you don't go to the game, be wary of fireworks. (I flew out of bed one of the nights because I didn't know what was happening!). My only recommendations are about the food. I ordered breakfast and a late dinner (room service) and they were both bad. There are plenty of restaurants around the hotel that serve great food and I recommend that you take a quick walk. One major complaint I had was when I placed my order for breakfast room service. The operator asked if I wanted a bottle of water and I said yes, but was not happy when I received my bill and found out that a bottle of water was $8.00. My room service breakfast bill (before tip) was $32.00, which included breakfast and the infamous bottle of water… ouch. Besides the $8.00 bottle of water, this is a great hotel and is only a few blocks away from the Convention Center, Sea World, and the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: weeter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 2 and 3, 2007. Booked two rooms through Priceline for about $100 per room per night, a real bargain considering the quality of this hotel. We stayed on the 11th floor. The rooms do vary somewhat in size. One room, next to the elevator, was quite large; the space was nice, but there was a little noise from the elevator, which may possibly disturb a light sleeper. Our rooms didn't have great views, which was OK considering the discount price. Except for the view, however, the rooms were top class, very clean and comfortable, nicely stocked with toiletries and fluffy towels. My husband and son went to the top floor to check out the exercise area. Strangely one has to walk past the bar bouncers and through the bar to get to the exercise room. Exercisers are on full view of the bar patrons through the windows also. The hotel location was excellent, close to public transportation. Breakfast at the restaurant was rather expensive, but plentiful and served by pleasant wait staff. At the front of the restaurant in the morning there is free Starbucks coffee. Front desk staff was kind and helpful also. $26 a night to park (plus tips) seemed to be pricey (but typical for this area). We parked in the parking garage across the street for less than half the price. Staying here was a treat. This hotel is among the nicest business and convention hotels that I have ever stayed in, and is equally nice for a pleasure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyG-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night (booked thru Priceline deal). It is an extensively refurbished hotel and the theme is contemporary/modern, although you wouldn't know it by bldg exterior appearance. Service, linen, toiletries, bed were all great. Great location as well. Good view of Petco stadium infield from bar on 22nd floor. Lots of new bldgs going up in the area. San Diego must be booming. Valet parking only ($26 per night).

Reviews.Title: “hip hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: DawnNoelm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, the most recent was New Years Eve 2005 - so over a year ago - but it is a great location - the rooms are hip and very clean. If you are going to a Padre game - cannot beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...walking distance to everything downtown”
Reviews.Author: puppylov
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for my birthday and had a wonderful time. Easy walking distance to the main Gaslamp district but yet far enough removed that you don't hear any noise. We had a room facing the city on the 20th floor and we're worried we would hear everything (from the street and nightclub on the 22nd floor, but we had lots of peace and quiet. My only complaint with noise would have to be with the toilets which were extremely loud when flushing...you could hear the toilets around you flush as well. Great service and nice candy selection at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, ‘fab roof top bar’”
Reviews.Author: EEYORETIGGERR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a really good location, a couple of minutes walk from the trendy gas lamp quarter. The roof top bar is excellent with fab views over the ball park and Marina. The gym is located on the roof and has a good range of equipment and individual TVs next to the cardio machines. Our room was of a really high standard and had good views of the marina. All in all a good quality 4 star hotel and I would definitely recommend if you are staying in San Diego especially if there is a baseball game going on (although it may be difficult to get a reservation.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to be”
Reviews.Author: BVH
Reviews.Content: What a suprise .... flew in from Vegas ... San Diego was so so different (Quiet and Quaint). Room cards let you off only at your floor or top floor. Got a suprise from the roof bar ..... the ball game was on next door ... we had a fabulous view. The rooms were great and the staff dead helpful. The hotel location was great for the gaslamp Quarter and pretty good for everything else. We didnt have a car so local transport was on hand. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone .... and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: christy2064
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night and really liked it. I think its in a great location. It's right in the heart of the Gaslamp district and next to the baseball park. The staff is very friendly, nice lobby, and the rooms are nice sized. The beds are the best, very comfortable with nice linens. They have a great rooftop bar that looks out to the bay and downtown and into the ball park. It also has a fire pit and couches all around. Great happy hour too. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get in...!”
Reviews.Author: jiuyen
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. I had booked my reservation far in advance, and I called on check-in day to ensure that my reservation would be held for late check-in. Despite this, I was told upon arrival that the hotel had been overbooked and that I would have to go elsewhere. To the hotel's credit, they had arranged for accomodation at a nearby hotel with a comparable star rating. However, that substitute hotel was quite far from the downtown nightlife, and it was the proximity to downtown nightlife that had convinced me to choose the San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter in the first place. I wasn't the only one turned away that night. When I pulled up to valet my car, the kind valet told me that I should check with the front desk before bothering to take my luggage out of the trunk, because he had seen many, many people get turned away that night. My advice: be careful when booking at this hotel. A reservation(even one paid in full in advance, as mine was) doesn't necessarily mean that you will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Would Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: yiyi + boys
Reviews.Content: We are in town annually for a convention. So, I was excited that the hotel was so convenient to the Convention Center. It's a lovely, clean and modern hotel but I would definitely look elsewhere next year. It was pricey for its sparse accommodations. I had requested a refrigerator several times and was told that they would contact me if there was a problem. Naturally, I was never informed of the status. I had to ask the concierge several times and was told each time either that they will try or that they did not have any left. I had also requested a microwave. That request was never addressed either. There is no pool onsite. If you wanted to go for a swim you had to go to a different hotel. The website lists a 27" flat screen tv which is not true. There is a complimentary breakfast but only for certain guests. Because of its convenience we would ocassionally drop by our room in the afternoon and it hadn't been cleaned yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: Danni0005
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. Very modern lobby. I loved the vibe. Room was very nice. I paid extra for a late check-out, but housekeeping was banging on my door and trying to enter all afternoon--even when I called down to confirm I had asked for late check out. Front desk is extremely snobby. Do they realize they are working the front desk? No reason to act rude. I was there for baseball, and went to the rooftop bar after. They close at midnight, and then room service also closes at midnight. That is ridiculous in a city as big as San Diego and downtown. THey told me to go to the grocery store across the street. The valets are awesome! They make the hotel. Very cute and funny. Great attitudes. THe front dest should take a lesson from them!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: spontane1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for a girls' night out. We stayed in a regulary room with 2 queen bed -- which were so comfortable. If there is one thing that I love Marriott for, it's their beds! I have no complaints about the room. It was clean, we had a beautiful view of the water and could see right into Petco Baseball Stadium(which is right next door). The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Other pluses: - Bar & Lounge on the roof of the hotel -- very close for a night out on the town. - Close to bars and resturants located in Gaslamp Quarter Some downfalls for staying at this hotel: - No pool on site, but are allowed access to pool at Marriott down the street (about 5-7 minute walk). - No self parking. Only valet provided by the hotel. There is a parking structure across the street which is expensive and crowded when there is a baseball game. All in all, it's a nice hotel, but pricey. If you are willing to shell out the money for a nice location in the Gaslamp Quarter and clean and very comfortable rooms, then it's all worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: justhavefun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 11-14 during a girlfriend getaway, a business contact that lives in S.D. recommended this hotel to me. Beautiful facility, glad we were there on weekend because noisy construction nearby started up first thing Monday am. Great rooms and very comfortable beds. Top notch baths with wonderful toiletries. Note that using online PC in the business center is VERY expensive. Only real downer was that front desk folks were really snooty but the valets more than made up for them. The valets here were invaluable to us every day in helping us get to our destinations and giving us tips on places to go. The breakfast buffet in the onsite restaurant was very good. Walk to Cafe 222 for breakfast, too - if you have time to wait . . it's quite wonderful. The hotel's rooftop skybar has great views. My friend liked their workout facility. We both liked this location a lot; I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for baseball and sunshine fans!”
Reviews.Author: AntZuzu
Reviews.Content: The bar on the 22nd floor is a must see - but the rest of the hotel is painfully average. I had to check-in early, due to the travel issues in August 2006, and called to confirm this with the hotel the night before. I was assured this would be 'no problem' - but of course it was. I arrived at 9:00am and was able to check in "earlier than everyone else...", the clerk said snidely, at 1:00pm. No Pool, but a shuttle to the Marriott next to the Convention Center. The restaurant - Soleil on K was okay. Breakfast on Sunday was delicious; lunch and dinner - skip it. Again, no matter the food was expensive and average - great food was just a couple of blocks away in all directions. Concierge acted like he was a bit put-out by us mere commoners; but since the SF Giants and their young families were also staying in the hotel the week for four games, I guess I understand why they were preoccupied. Sleeping rooms were comfortable, and the bathrooms were spacious. The view of the ballpark was amazing, but if you are not into baseball, you may want to ask to stay on the "other side of Petco Field".

Reviews.Title: “Skip the pricey bay view rooms”
Reviews.Author: JHROrange
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Gaslamp Hotel has much to recommend. It is only steps from Petco Stadium and the interior furnishings are fabulous. The hotel is decorated in a minimalist fashion and I truly appreciated the granite and upgraded materials throughout our room and bathroom. However, there is one glaring problem with this hotel and that involves their definition of a "bay view". We paid $300 for a bay view room and yet we could only see patches of the bay due to the big, fat Omni Hotel that sat directly in front of our hotel. In fact, our main view was of the Omni Hotel and the top level of a parking garage. I feel that it is somewhat dishonest of the Marriott to descirbe their rooms as having a "bay view" when in reality, these views are obstructed. If you truly want a full bay view stay at the Marriott or Hyatt at the Convention Center or (of course!) the Omni!. The hotels at the convention center are within easy walking distance of the Gaslamp Quarter and Petco Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: ravens1
Reviews.Content: First time in San Diego, and we booked our stay via Priceline, so we had no idea what to expect. All I can say is wow. Great hotel, great room, great location. You absolutely can't say enough about this hotel or location. Basically, the previous reviewers covered everything, so let me just say ditto on all the good stuff said!

Reviews.Title: “Family with Kids Enjoyed Our Stay - Would Return”
Reviews.Author: babygame
Reviews.Content: We were a little surprised when we booked this on Priceline, to find out it had no pool and there was a $24 parking fee. However, we did not regret our stay - we had a great time (Mom and 2 daughers - 9 & 14). So close to Gaslamp Quarters - which my 14-year old daughter loved for the nearby upscale stores as well as the mall selections at Horton Plaza (all within easy walking distance). Being so cose to Petco Park, you have to hate baseball if you do not attend. You can easily buy tickets at the walk-up window, including the "park within the park" - a grassy hill behind center field for only $5, $8 for bleachers (being a Giants fans these bleachers do not compare as you cannot see game well) or $12 for view deck (top). We wanted to go 2 nights, but got back too late for the 2nd one. First night we got free hats, second night they were giving away t-shirts. Traffic around the hotel, even with a game going on, is not bad. We left area along with afternoon ballpark traffic and were only delayed about 10-15 minutes. Liked looking out the window at the park preparation activity, to check scoreboard at night. Could even see peaks of Coronado Hotel across the bay. Enjoyed close proximity to ice-cream store and Subway's (across the street). Liked going for walks in the morning along the marina (near convention center). Short hop over to Coronado - great beach. Easy access to Old Town and Mission Valley for shopping. Fun to be in a central location - with lots of action!! Also, very comfortable rooms, albeit we had 2 full beds (would have preferred 2 queens). Requested a refrigerator and got it at no charge - quite roomy. Will return again!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, no tolerance”
Reviews.Author: dmsea1
Reviews.Content: Valentine's Day weekend, so I had big plans for my girlfriend and I. We went out that night, and came back to wind down. We were pretty tired from the night, and were just talking, nothing more. Little did we know that a gold member was next door and decided that talking was too loud for them and had us kicked out. There were no other complaints made on us, and they didn't even investigate or give us a warning. So there we were, Valentine's weekend, every place was sold out, and they kicked us out. The night staff was very rude, and wouldn't listen to our side of the story. Because we weren't GOLD members, we didn't have a say. I made a formal complaint to the management who were no help either. The night staff had made up a lie to justify to management why we were kicked out, saying we had 15 people in our room It was myself and my girlfriend, and that was it. There are way too many choices to waste your money and time here.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Padres and Bay!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilyofcolorado
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Marriott client and I cannot say enough about how nice the stay last week was. The valet service, the front desk expedient service with a smile. The rooms that overlook the Padres and the Bay were incredible. The room itself lacks for nothing! The beds are extremely comfortable, the bathrooms large and well-equipped. The air conditioner is a wall unit and is very quiet. You can actually open the windows a crack if you need ambient noise because the rooms are so quiet. We ordered breakfast from room service the night before and it was brought up on time with a nice presentation and was very good. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again, the price, location service and amenities cannot be beat. Walking distance to many nightclubs and restaurants make it appealing to adults.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Remaxguy24
Reviews.Content: The Marriot, Gaslamp is a great hotel. Great location. Upon checking in there was a rude employee, she gave us the wrong room and wasted about 45 min of our time, but other than that it was a great experience. The concierge was great! They reccommended the best breakfest place 222 (check it out). Long wait but great vibe and food. There isn't a pool but who could always just walk to the other Marriot in teh Marina ans use theres, thats what we did. I enjoyed this hotel so much I'm going on a weekend this month.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Prescotttraveler
Reviews.Content: We got a great mid-week rate through priceline. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are large and the beds are comfy. We even were allowed to take out dog for no extra charge! The service was wonderful and we could walk anywhere we wanted to go from the hotel - a bonus in a city where parking can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations overall”
Reviews.Author: JeromePineau
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights for my wife's birthday on a San Diego "Adventure" package. Excellent hotel overall. The "package" is really nothing more than free valet parking and included breakfast. At $24/day for parking and $30/day for breakfast for 2, it's not a bad deal. When they have tickets to the attractions (they ran out of zoo tickets) they are not really discounted. I dont know about the 15% discounts advertized on restaurant. no one ever offered us anything. The concierge services are fairly useless (they have no clue about anything), the restaurant kitchen _really_ suffers (but the staff tries real hard) and the staff at the ground-level bar consistently looks like they're about to have a breakdown. Either way the overwhelming reason to stay at this new place is the bar on the rooftop. you simply cannot beat that bar and we'd stay there again anytime just for the priviledge of accessing that 22nd floor w/o waiting in line! altho the service up there is also fairly non-existant, the views and the "crowd" are simply to die for. We watched the baseball game live there as the sun was setting. Killer sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Easter and really enjoyed the Marriott. They had no problem with an early check-in which was great as we were exhausted having travelled down from San Francisco over the previous few days. The room was really clean and inviting with lovely decor, great bathroom, lots of towels, very comfortable bed (and really nice toiletries). The location is perfect - we walked every night to the restaurants and bars on nearby fourth and fifth, and also to the Italian area and the marina during the afternoons. The public transport is also really good and not far from the hotel. The Altitude bar on the roof of the hotel was a lovely treat - definitely a highlight of our stay. Front desk were always really helpful when I had questions and the restaurant was lovely for lunch on our first day, when we were too tired to head straight out into the rain to find somewhere to eat. We really loved San Diego (I would recommend Bandar for dinner, and the Cheese Shoppe for lunch) and if going there again, would stay in the Gas Lamp Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight is the bar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is one of many new hotels competing for guests in San Diego. I have previously stayed at the Hyatt and Westin in the city and although the rooms may be bigger in the other two, this hotel beat them on style! The hotel is ideally located in the Gaslamp only minutes walk from the bars and restaurants. Just beware that being a military town the crowds around the bars can get a little aggressively drunk, which brings down the whole atmosphere of this city. The bar on the top of the hotel has brilliant views of the city and the harbour and was a great place to finish off the night. Although on our first night, having travelled 20 hours across the Atlantic, I didn't appreciate the noise from the corridor and the subsequent party in the room next to us. Dispappointing that it doesn't have a pool, but you can use the Marriott Harbour's pool just a short walk away too. If you intend to park, use the self-park across the street for $12/day, even if it doesn't have in/out privileges it can still be cheaper than the valet at $24!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: squink
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night’s stay. I requested an early check in (9am) and a late check out (3pm) staff was very accommodating. Room was spotless, well stocked with plenty of towels, toiletries and had very comfortable beds. There is plenty to see and do within the gaslamp area. No need to rent a car if you’re willing to wait a little. The mass transit system is within walking distance, easy to use and very affordable. I had my grandson with me and the only downside is that there is no pool at this hotel. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RKNLOVESCOFFEE
Reviews.Content: I thank everyone else's reviews before mine because I really studied up on which hotels to stay at, even though I am a Marriott employee myself. I never visited San Diego before, so input was most appreciated. My first night was at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott in Dana Point and then the following 2 nights at the San Diego Marriott Marina (both of which I will write about on their sites). After staying at the Marriott Marina, I reluctantly moved over to the Gaslamp because the Marina was sold out my last night there. I wasn't reluctant to go there because of anything negative of the GasLamp Marriott, but we SO LOVED...the Marina Marriott that I was worried. First the Positives: The lobby was beautiful, simple but clean and elegant. My room was 1900 which was a corner room which had two huge sliding glass door sized windows (but they weren't sliding glass doors), and they opened on the bottom for fresh air. Around the corner of the room was a whole other area with a HUGE workstation for those of you there for business. Also a nice sitting chair in the corner and the desk chair was cushy too. If someone were working there, the other person sleeping around the corner wouldn't be too disturbed. THE ROOM WAS SPOTLESS. Not one fingerprint, dust ball or window streak. The beds had the new bedding which was really nice, flat screen t.v., nice carpeting, beautiful woodwork, even the bathroom door (which was a really cool sliding door with chrome on the bottom), great toiletries, great coffee pot (chrome with FLAVORED CREAMERS!). Now just a few negatives: Parking was expensive (like all downtown hotels). I believe the parking garage was around $20 dollars a day (valet only), and that's because there is NO PULL IN FOR INCOMING CARS. Just a plain old sidewalk. They did let me park my rental car there for a few minutes to check in and go quickly to my room, but I needed to come down right away and move it or they needed to valet it. The walk to the GasLamp was a few blocks, down Fifth street, but it was raining and those few blocks seemed far in the rain (we had sore feet too), so we took a cab to the waterfront area. Right across the street was CONSTRUCTION that probably would have been really annoying if we had been there a few days and trying to sleep in the morning. A HUGE CRANE was right across the street peering through the window. We had to leave at 4:30 a.m. the next moring for the airport, so that wasn't an issue for us. I would highly recommend this hotel though. The people working there were ALL VERY NICE and the concierge was great.
