BUT, I was traveling with my 14 yr. old daughter and we much more enjoyed the Marriott Marina on N. Harbor because the VIEWS VIEWS VIEWS from our bayside 19th floor room. Plus, we walked every evening right along the marina to the Seaport Village shops and restaurants. It was a short, safe and beautiful walk. The GasLamp had no pool, so the pool at the other property made it a much more desirable property. The GasLamp is a short hike, for you business travelers, to the Convention Center (not a great walk in heels). The Marina Marriott was RIGHT THERE. So even though the location, parking, non-pool could be an issue, it still is a beautiful hotel. Also, the rooftop bar was closed for renovation, but do to reopen March 31st. Hope that helps! Cab ride from hotel to airport only $10.80, not including tip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Gaslamp Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: las2cun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the Gaslamp Marriott and we thought the hotel was great. The hotel decor is lovely and the room was very comfortable. Our room overlooked the ballpark and we only wish there had been a game because that would have been super fun to watch! The Altitude bar on the roof top was a great place to begin the evening with a bottle of wine. We did that both nights before venturing down to the gaslamp quarter for dinner. We also checked out Croce's for live jazz and that was terrific, too. Parking at the Marriott is expensive, so we opted to park in the garage across the street for about half the price the one day we did have a rental car. That leads me to the one problem I had with the Marriott...I noticed on the day of checkout that they had charged me $96 for parking and we had never used their garage. The matter was resolved quickly, though I had to contact a supervisor because the front desk was not authorized to remove a charge that large. In any case, I would recommend the hotel...just make sure to check you bill at the end of your stay to ensure you weren't overcharged.

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: MadronaSeattle
Reviews.Content: Brand new bueatiful rooms. Very W like in a great location. Years ago you had to stay in the towers next to the convention center. Now there are great options like this one in the Gaslamp. Pricey but what is not in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since I booked my room blindly on Priceline, I wasn't sure what to expect from the Marriott San Diego Gaslamp Quarter. But I was happily surprised when I arrived at the hotel -- as other reviews state, it's definitely the nicest Marriott I've ever seen. Rooms were clean and spacious and ours had a great view of the bay as well as of Petco Park. An added plus the hotel has a rooftop bar, which has amazing views of the ballpark, bay and the rest of the city. I will definitely stay here again when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TxnAquarian
Reviews.Content: As one of San Diego's newest properties, the Marriott Gaslmap Quarter is a hip, trendy and utterly surprising hotel. Located just next to Petco Park and in the heart of the Gaslamp, this is a convenient and great place to stay. And as far as Marriotts go, this is head-and-shoulders above their typical properties. This Marriott is geared more towards a W Hotel crowd, with its dim lighting, super-chic lobby and hip rooftop bar. The room we had on the 14th floor had a nice view of the bay and was complete with a marble bathroom and upgraded bedding with an amazing down comforter. The hotel was just renovated last year (it used to be the run-down eyesore called The Clarion) and still has the look and smell of a new building. Everything was immaculate. The staff was friendly and readily available to assist. On a side note, there is a hefty $24-dollar/per night parking charge, but that is typical of staying downtown. Also, the rooftop bar seems to be one of the hottest spots in town. Therefore, crowds gather in the lobby and one or two elevators are blocked off for them. Some people might have a negative vibe from this "see and be seen" crowd. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will make it a point to visit again during our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only have good things to say about this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights in a great 2 room suite. We found the staff to be helpful and always got a cab within 2 minutes of requesting one from the valet. Naturally our breakfast in the hotel restaurant was a little expensive but we expected as much and only ate there once. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Tries too hard to be chic”
Reviews.Author: Bucknut_Girl
Reviews.Content: We had a large group of friends and got several rooms at the Marriott for the weekend. We liked the location and the fact that it was a relatively new hotel. The rooms were pretty clean, and we were given one with a great view of Petco Park and the bay. The only thing that was suboptimal was the service. For such a pricey and "hip" hotel, the attitude was a little much. For example, on saturday nights a line forms around the lobby of people who want to get upstairs to the rooftop bar. There are several staff in dark suits and ear phones who man the elevators like secret servicemen with overinflated egos. They actually made guests wait while they held the elevator for bar goers, and we had to show our room key to get anywhere near it after getting blockaded by the staff. The restaurant was overpriced ($12 martinis), and the food was so so. I had a waitress argue with me about what I ordered when the wrong thing came out, instead of just apologizing and replacing the meal. The final issue was getting a cab in the morning. A late night staff told us to call the front desk 10-15 minutes ahead of time, and it would be no problem. When we called, we got forwarded to several other lines then got a voice mail box. It took 20 minutes for the valet to hail one after we arrived downstairs. Loved the hotel, but the staff needs a lot more training.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Nicest Marriott I've Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: TravlinMan
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel -- I've stayed in more Marriott flags than I can remember, but none came close to this brand new (12/04) place. The lobby is beautifully decorated, clean and contemporary with art from local artists all around. The rooms are beautiful -- not your usual polyester bedspread...this hotel features Marriott's new bedding (ala the Heavenly Bed at Westin), a beautiful marble walled bathroom and nice view of the bay and Petco Park. The rooftop bar (Skybar) is very popular on the weekends, with a line for non-guests stretching through the lobby to get upstairs. Hotel guests go right up. Especially attractive for the 20 and 30 somethings. Services were all around better than normal -- front desk and restaurant staff were very cheerful and helpful. The only spot on that record was that we'd called for fresh towels Sunday morning and they hadn't arrived 45 minutes later. We finally picked up old ones and used those and called to tell them not to bother. Seemed to be a fluke, however, as the next morning we called and got new towels in less than 5 minutes. The breakfast buffet was your standard fare for a hotel of this caliber...but it was $18 too. Unfortunately, the gaslamp is more geared to dinner and drinking than breakfast...so your breakfast options are limited. There is, however, a nice breakfast spot down K street about 3 or 4 blocks west. As another reviewer noted, there is no pool...kinda strange...but you do have reciprocol privileges at the Marriott at the Convention Center -- friends in our group went there and said it was crowded and not pleasant. I've also stayed there...and had the same feeling about the rooms. The other Marriott is about 5 or 6 blocks? away...but there is no shuttle, so if you want to swim, you have to walk or drive. I agree with the other reviews on the parking situation -- we didn't have a car, but folks in our group did. If there isn't a game at the stadium, parking should be ample in the garage right across the street (contrary to another reviewer, I know that there is parking in the hotel itself -- but I suppose they do use the garage across the street for overflow). Park it yourself across the street and you should save plenty off of the $24 tab. Sounds pricey, but things aren't free in DT San Diego. Workout facilities were also pretty decent. I wasn't especially looking for a pool, and I didn't rent a car, so those issues weren't a big deal to me. Like I said, an all around very good hotel. Of our group of about 15 people, nobody had a bad thing to say -- and we were wondering how much better the Omni can be, just a block away, for twice the price? By the way, got our rooms via Priceline at $130 a night -- over Labor Day Weekend.

Reviews.Title: “nOT WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Check out the Marina Marriot before you stay here... Executive suite was like a prison... No windows to really look out inless you were 6 feet tall.. Bathroom products were not brought to the room on a daily basis... You would have to call down to the front desk to get fresh towels and shampoo.. Staff is very attentive... NOT WORTH 500.00 A NIGHT

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: AZBearDown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp and we had a nice stay. The hotel only has valet parking and it is $26 but it was quick and easy. Check-in was efficient but only one of the two keys they provided ended up working. Our room was on the 16th floor and had nice views of the bay and PETCO Park. We were there to see a ballgame and the hotel was great for that. The room was quite small but the furniture looked brand new and the bathroom was fine. The hotel is on 6th Ave and you really need to walk down to 5th Ave and up a few blocks to get to the heart of the Gaslamp, but it is an easy walk. The area directly around the hotel is under construction but the noise could not be heard in our room unless we opened the windows. The hotel has a nice looking restaurant but we only ate breakfast there and there is a rooftop bar that seemed popular but we only looked inside. Overall the hotel was good for us, it had easy access to the Gaslamp District and PETCO Park, and the rooms were small but clean. A big negative would be if you arrived on the day (within a couple of hours) of a home game because it appeared to me that you would not have direct access to the valet (the police close most of roads in that area) and parking would be a nightmare otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “A++++++++”
Reviews.Author: tjh17
Reviews.Content: After spending one night at another hotel, which once again did not look like the pictures, we decided to search out a new one. We wandered into the Marriott Gaslamp and immediately fell in love. From the moment we walked in we were greeted with a smile and the best possible service you could imagine. The front dest supervisor went out of her way to make us feel at home and the night manager even gave us a tour of the hotel and made sure we were happy with the room before we checked in. The rooms were absolutely gorgeous and the bed was comfortable beyond belief. The bathroom was stunning, with all the amenities of home, including high end tolietries. Everyone was very helpful and always smiling. We felt like royalty! The hotel is in the gaslamp district, with shops and dining within walking distance and our room overlooked the baseball stadium. It is because of this hotel and its wonderful staff that we will definatley seek out Marriott properties in the future. Stay at this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

HotelInfo.Name: San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: 660 K Street, San Diego, CA 92101
